UKbWG6ON-enfcp-v7RDqeA.text: We loved the green chile dip they had as a featured appetizer a couple weeks ago. The margaritas are great (the frozen have a lot of tequila but you can't taste it). My bf always gets the steak burrito. I tried the hatch green chile chicken enchiladas and they were awesome! I want to try the Bloody Mary bar next time--they only have that on the weekends.

IEB0NVcU7BOv_TyYnMwT-g.text: This southwestern themed restaurant has its appeals.  So I expected Mexican food with an American twist.  Most places that serve bread when your meal.  But Z'Tejas goes above and beyound and delivers cornbread.  I would have to say this is the best part of my meal.  There are even corn pieces in the piping hot bread in the cute iron pan.  It's fluffy and warm and the perfect way to start of the meal.  I almost got full just by eating the cornbread before my food came out.  I went during lunchtime and ordered the shrimp papaya enchiladas.  Shrimp, papaya, celery, onion and spices are wrapped in soft corn tortillas.  A black bean sauce covered the enchilada.  The meal also came with a corn rice and salad.  I barely tasted the papaya, but the shrimp turned out very well.  It was soft, but not chewy.  The black bean sauce was a bit dry and hardened the enchilada. There were vegetables added on top of the enchildas, but the bell peppers seemed too soggy and bland.  I believe the additional vegetables were superfluous and didn't add to the value of the dish. The salad was not special, but adding corn to the rice was a unique way to serve it.  It blended well with the cornbread that was served throughout the meal.   They do have a variety of food selections on the Happy Hour menu.  I think I'll go back and try some of the other dishes.  And mainly I would go back just for the cornbread alone.  :-) Overall, the food is average, what I typically expect from a chain restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. shrimp papaya enchiladas

KHpPcVS-bDU4TCSxQARKWg.text: We were in the neighborhood and decided to try Z'Tejas Southwestern Grill for lunch and were super glad we did as it was an excellent meal!  Ambiance & Decor.  - Very nicely decorated in, naturally, a Southwestern style. Although it is a fairly large room and was getting fairly busy by the time we left, it was not noisy at all. Very nice!  Food.  - The buttermilk corn bread is superb! Served in a small skillet with a side of butter it is airy and really, really good. As yummy as it is though, I do wish they would offer a jalapeno or green chili version.   - Based on our waitresses recommendation, I had the Diablo Pasta (spinach & red pepper linguine, spicy cream sauce, Cotija cheese, and jalapenos) - and I had to agree with her it was VERY good - and VERY rich.   - The better 1/2's Five-cheese Macaroni & Achiote Chicken (Jack, cheddar, Parmesan, Romano & bleu cheese, bacon gratin) was also delicious - and also pretty decadent.  Service.  - We got off to a bit of slow start when the hostess tried to sit us right next to the service area where at least 10 staff members were conducing business, but our request for a quieter table was readily & happily agreed to (but we should not have had to ask as it was not busy at when we got there). Our server while very friendly, and knowledgeable could have been a bit more attentive. A manager walked by to check on things - which I always take as a good sign!!  We are already looking forward to our next visit!

SIhAZzcbcRX5WciaJB5a3Q.text: While in Az i Had a hankering for the Chambord Margarita!!!! Mmmmm! Muy bueno! Oh and the pecan crusted salad was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

8UZRpKHD0SfG5AH4fOhEJw.text: Great food with friendly service.  This location is close to my office so I end up having a lot of client/vendor lunches here.  The food is great and the prices are right.  The menu offers lots of choices for everyone.

dn7VnvqTzQilBUV3iBVgxQ.text: Came here for a baby shower, yes a baby shower! The restaurant staff was awesome and very accommodating. This restaurant in particular had a pretty nice private area where my friend was able to set up pretty nicely. Overall, I think it was great!

BjWeThqaggcaRPIBWaU5cA.text: I have an allergy to chipotle, usually I steer clear of Mexican food but my family wanted to eat here. I expressed my concerns of chipotle to our waitress Stacie and she suggested a meal and let the kitchen know about my allergy. The food was AMAZING! And the manager even came over to reassure me that my meal was being well prepared. Such a great friendly staff!! I have never been to a restaurant where they cared so much that I had a good experience. Definitely 5 stars from us!

Wyqzv2OYEXTHrkJowc88WA.text: Always a good time coming here. Great service, great food, and AMAZING HAPPY HOUR! Mon-fri 3-7pm and sat-sun 3-5pm. Margaritas are bomb, my favorite is the fruit infused patron or the chambord. WARNING: they sneak up on you quick!  My favorite appetizers are the Tejas trio, shrimp & guac tostada bites, and street tacos.

Fv_hfkAu2IZWuxw0MlQeaA.text: I reviewed a couple of reviews from previous individuals.    This place was great!  I was able to get seated quickly and greeted by my server.    I asked the server for the his recommended margarita and his choice was on point.    They brought out corn bread which is one of the best I have ever had and the street tacos were there too.    My wait period for the tacos was very minimal.    I would definitely recommend trying this place out.    Previous reviews said that the guacamole is great so I definitely make another trip to try it out.    Cleanliness:  A+ Service:  A+ Price:  $$ Recommend:  Yes

c8944UZEH77mjdxFMdN0KQ.text: I haven't been here in a while but yelp wasn't around when I came here. It was my birthday and I ordered the steak and it was marinated to perfection. My father brings home food from here sometimes and it is always good. Try it out, it's Tex-mex!

exIsuVqQDCIohHLmZZ-PYQ.text: We went to Z Tejas for dinner Saturday night after cocktails at the sandbar. We should've eaten at sandbar!! We don't live close to a tejas so we don't frequent the joint-- but we've had brunch several times and we're pleased. This dinner was low scale. It was like Olive Garden -- clearly pre-made and flavorless. I had chicken stuffed with spinach, mushrooms and se bland sauce And my hubby had the paper thin ribeye with bland sauce. The vegetables and potatoes looked the same on every plate (pet peeve). Boooo! Service was decent... That's why you got two stars. We won't return!

O7r6Cy0KcH0ryIp5w22XMA.text: We usually dine in when we eat at Z'Tejas, but this time decided to place a to go order.  The hostess sent me to the bar to pick it up, which I hate.  As usual when this happens, I stood at the bar with my thumb up my a$$ waiting to get the bartender's attention.  He was super busy while the hostess went back to her podium to do absolutely nothing.  The food here is decent.  One dish I highly recommend is the diablo chicken.  If not for this dish, I probably wouldn't eat there as often though.  The corn bread is a nice touch and they're not stingy about bringing more.

UAnBm5fSgxStbJBTIKfKLg.text: Queso was THICK, tasted like velveta, and cost 8.50. Street tacos very bland. Used to Street tacos having se spice, or flavor. Boo! Drinks were good.

R9uCBXBvhCVp9qTFb4ZJfA.text: Came here for a work lunch. The queso and street tacos were amazing.  Good service.   Will be back.

rSUTCDyQk_kG6j1IGUzmYQ.text: Stopped in on a Friday before happy hour ended. On the way in a couple  leaving was saying how upset they were about the service. We were seated and the waiter didnt even greet us just asked what we want to drink. seemed annoyed that we wanted to hurry and order before 7. Their prices are outrageous. $12.00 for a tiny quesadilla regular price. I would only go for happy hour. The drinks are on point!

F2mIULAjUzUOH3Fhp74V9Q.text: A decent southwest meal from a chain.  Kind of reminded me of a little more upscale Chili's.  Not bad, but also not great either.  The margaritas just didn't have the right sour mix. A basic margarita should have a good balance but this was just all sour and too bitter.  The trio of dips had very good queso, decent guacamole, and fair salsa.  The chips were plentiful though.  As for the main course, I had the salmon and it was utterly forgettable. Perhaps I should know better than to order fresh fish when you're not near the ocean, but it was just disappointing.    Overall, though, a solid choice for friends to get together.

Jh-KESadjkXn2FtXIYvHXQ.text: I had some of the best Ahi tuna I have experience in a long time. Rare actually did mean rare, I am glad to see that their cooks have been trained in the are of tuna searing.   The tamari tuna is basically a sesame crusted seared tuna on a bed of rice and veggies with a great Chile sauce, think of it as an upscale jap-mex fusion.  The tuna itself was of a very high grade, sliced thinly and a dark ruby red. It was tender and lacked the sinuous bits cheaper ahi can have. The flavor was fresh and well accompanied by the tamari crusted sesame seeds.   I also had a small salad with their sesamee ginger dressing, which is so good that  I would order in cocktails if it were not frowned upon.   There was also a copious amount of corn bread so I could get my south western starch fix.

HgFtopoLF3e7tOWhDUdGbg.text: I went here yesterday for lunch. I had no idea what to expect from this place.  We ordered the chips and salsa. I also ordered the smoked duck tacos.   The server was nice and attentive to us. When we arrived, it was around 2pm so it was pretty empty.  Since this is a mexican restaurant, I was expecting different items on the menu. Well, it is a chain so it seems more of Mexican fusion than real Mexican food.   The chips and salsa came with three different types of salsa (one green one that had some avocado and two red ones [one was spicy and one was mild]). The salsa was good but nothing exceptionally. The chips were nicely crispy and they came in two colors.  The cornbread is buttery and filling. It is soft and I can taste little bits of corn in it. It comes with a side of butter but I didn't add butter to it because I felt like it had enough flavor. The cornbread comes out hot and fresh.  My smoked duck tacos were good. I like the side of slaw with it, it gave a fresh crisp to it. The marinade for the duck tacos were a little overpowering. They definitely did give a lot of duck sauce. The plating was nice, it was on a long rectangular plate. It was a little difficult to eat on such a skinny plate. The tortilla was nicely crisp and not too soft so it made it easier to eat. The sauce seems like a mayo-based sauce on top. It was good. I did wish they gave us more slaw on the side though. I like the duck meat although they had lots of sauce on it.  Parking is in the parking lot so parking is easy.  +Good cornbread -Not real mexican food, so if you want real mexican food, this is not the place to come too +Plating is nice +Service is attentive

9u0h_gXu3vruygGcY_i0yQ.text: This spot has some big pluses and some bigger minuses.  On the plus side - the food quality is decent. Environment is cool The flavor of the steak street tacos was pretty good too. Server was pleasant but not trained to ensure customers concerns are addressed.   On the negative - EVERYTHING has chipotle flavor. Even Chipotles restaurant doesn't have this much Chipotle flavoring. I do not like the smoky flavor of chipotle. My husband doesn't mind it but this was even too much for him.   Guac - chipotle Tabasco (luckily we asked for no Tabasco so the guac wasn't ruined)  SW Caesar - Chipotle dressing. It wasn't listed as having it. We probably took 3 bites between us of the salad. Wasted $$. We did mention to the waiter that it was Chipotle dressing (which I'd previously told him I don't like so to keep anything Chipotle off the food). He said "Oh really?"  Didn't offer to replace or refund it either.   Street Tacos: asked for no chipotle sauce but it came with it anyway.   On a previous visit: Shrimp and Guac Tostada bites. Asked for no Chipotle sauce but it came with it still on it.   Red Chile and Mango Steak Salad- husband says it was great. No idea if it had chipotle sauce. If not - it's a minor miracle.   Seriously!! ENOUGH with chipotle mayo on every dang thing you serve. Diversify your flavors please. After 2 visits, we are done. Tired of paying for food we won't eat. (We didn't ask for items to be replaced. The first visit I was with clients and didn't want to fuss. Second visit I scraped it off the tacos because my husband was hungry and the waiter wasn't around. Second visit part 2 (the SW salad) I told the waiter and he shrugged it off,saying "Its a Smoky flavor but not chipotle". Chipotle IS smoky. Argh.   Could easily be a 4 star if they made orders right and tried other sauces on their food.   OH! The salsa is chipotle too.

12IsA6FGeXK9b8-KVDRw3w.text: I came here for an easy dinner and margarita during happy hour. I had the most awesome waiter named Chris. He was attentive yet didn't try to push anything onto us, you know like many does. He just rolled with the punches and our constantly changing demands. The food here isn't the awesomest, but the drinks are and the service goes along with that.   This place gets busy, even though it is huge but they can handle it. I am quite impressed by this. So to recap; Food is OK. Drinks are amazing. Chris is an awesome waiter. I think that summarizes it.

oNzgztj036m9pCmR5JGipQ.text: I've never had a bad meal at Z-Tejas.  My favorite is the Jerk Chicken Salad, but I've also had some great scallops there.  The cornbread is always delicious, and they're famous for their margaritas.

gR9bxbSvCJqFJBsszOvv7Q.text: I love love LOVE this place! Its next to my work which is convenient, but they answer my calls on the first ring, and always provide excellent service and food! Waitresses are very friendly and help me make decisions on what i should order! Their Jerk chicken chowder is MOUTH WATERING! but it is only a special, so i call everyday to see if they have it, and am DYING to have it again. Next time i will order it by the gallon and freeze it im not joking its amazing!!!

XjlG2x02oQ5Djy7_RPv3mg.text: Went to dinner about 7:00 on a Friday night to relax, share dinner and a margarita.  We were seated in the raised up area to find incredible noise, lots of  kids and loud laughing tables of people.  it is good to enjoy your dinner but it was chaotic, so loud we had to shout to hear each other, not relaxing in the least!  My bread plate was wet and had food on it, and the table next to us was cleared so haphazardly  that a tray of food was left on the chair and the next guest almost sat on it but we warned her.  it will be awhile before I would choose to eat there again!

Q3i30eOiUFG_CsDeFuiMJg.text: Great Food super service by Thomas - We  were up from Tucson and after shopping at Ikea  - needless to say tired - Thomas gave us great service and chit chatted with us  then  sent us on the ride back to Tucson with best wishes. thanks Thomas

LKR72MEYzrlCF50O9OxVGQ.text: I LOVE this place.  Great food at great prices with great service in a great atmosphere.  Great variety, great spices, great presentation, great menu.  Every entree gets a cornbread dish skillet to nibble on.  I think I would love everything on the menu.  Can't wait to go back and try them all.  Love It!!

rIzk1XjYlgYzDivAxg59Hg.text: Kudos for having a separate vegetarian menu -- it made it really easy to order. The chopped salad I had was decent, though more like a poor man's version of Burmese tea leaf salad. Minus one star for charging four bucks for chips & salsa.

-t8wABj-Z6ixks2o-CE_sQ.text: Great service! They serve cornbread instead of chips as an appetizer. It's yummy. The food is spicy and full of flavor. I was very impressed. And the dim lighting and decor make it a great place to take your date :)

CUIi3nco9x0EoPIn6KXIcg.text: The cornbread that they're so proud of is a bland version of jiffy corn muffin mix worst I've ever had. The five cheese Mac-n-cheese has no flavor they just melted some cheese over boiled noodles. The service was slow, the server seemed annoyed that he had to wait on me. I will not be going back.

WVH_MwGeboZtZOxDo5YDhQ.text: Always good! Like most of the other Yelpers...Cornbread is Crazy Yummy, Margaritas are Tasty & Potent! Everything here is consistent, service, food, and drinks.

dWjp50dPhOgvaiSIqdaIZQ.text: katie and i went here on sunday before an ikea trip.  let me start off by saying we were seriously starving, i was so pumped to order my jerk chicken salad. we walk in and theres a 'bloody mary bar' and it looked absolutely disgusting. i alsmot lost my appetite by being greeted by that filthy mess of a germ bar.    i sat down while katie used the restroom and i ordered us water and myself a drink.   katie and i sat talking for a bit and i asked, "are you going to get a drink?" "ya, if he ever comes back" was her response  then i realized it had been 10 minutes before we saw our waiter again. finally, he came around and tried to make us order chips. we were so hungry we almost did but passed them up. we ordered our food, it was sooooo cold in there I couldn't order my salad, instead i opted for a breakfast dish. and let me just say breakfast is not their strong point.   another 15 or so minutes go by and we can't take it so we order chips.   then we notice everyone around us is eating corn bread. HEY WHERE'S OUR CORNBREAD?!?! we don't need chips and salsa, we're supposed to get cornbread!   so our waiter passes by us again so we ask/shout for cornbread.  then, not even lying, our food, chips and salsa, and cornbread come to the table all at once. so overwhelming  the chips and salsa were not good.  my food was not good- i ordered the breakfast enchilada.  if you eat here, stick to the jerk chicken salad(one of the best salads ive ever had) or the spicy chicken pasta which is perfectly spicy.  2 stars for service 2 stars for food on this trip(usually i would give it 4) 2 stars for sunday morning ambiance(dinner is the time to go here)

Zwif3G0eX8d5LHGae_HA9w.text: THEY FREEZE THE TEQUILA!  margaritas a great, and they have yummy snacks.  good for happy hour.

11t2IB0DhdPT-93wpLhYnA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat. I am wild for the "wild mushroom enchiladas" -- have had them several times and have really enjoyed 'em. The complimentary cornbread and butter is very good, especially when it is served warm. I also love their pecan-crusted chicken spinach salad. The ahi tuna appetizer is a treat. ztejas.com

saJdBQSc7Q4A60AD4E-DhQ.text: I find this place okay... it gives consistently a-okay food, but nothing great.  The prices are good and the drinks are good.  I find the food a bit heavy.   The salsas tend to be too sweet for my taste and no where nearly spicy enough.  It's a good alternative to other big-box chain.

5mvav-nKcqk-dr4CloH7eg.text: I give them 5 because 1) food (salmon and salad with cornbread) was awesome and 2) GM turned a bad situation in a good one.  i am visiting and am staying at the hotel across the street.  I went there in a recommendation and got there at 6...ordered my food to go with these two girls who are hella young (warning sign).  so i sat and waited, playing my brick break on my blackberry.  I figured they would call me when the food was ready but no one called.  at 630 i got up to see whats going on...those girls in the front were like 'oh whats ur name, whats ur order,' and i believe my order was the only order they took.  they checked by the bar and was like 'oh here is ur order.'  of course i told them,dont you let ppl know their food is ready, and they were like 'oh ok'  idiots.  so i was upset of course and was about to pay when the gm came by and as like ' o my god were u waiting for this all this time?"  i told him i came in to order and thought the girls will let me know when the order was ready, and didnt know ihad to go to the bar to pay for it, which is way odd.  so he was like hey the food is cold, i will heat it up and just take it, dont pay, its our fault.  so for that i give them a 5 star review from what would have been a 1 star review.

vWMeZkREAMt4lsyovEzcHg.text: Z'Tejas = awesome margaritas, delicious salsa and guacamole, ruby trout salad, and not to mention the often overlooked and missed bananas foster french toast of the weekend brunch. They also have many delicious other entrees, some of which I have sampled, but I must say I stick with the favorite standbys. Also a great place for a happy hour bite. Try the Millionaire margarita on the rocks!

bq8GiA4DJNwojXfxAHtFkA.text: Money margaritas!  They hit u slow but guarantee a good night

3FiJOTZklr51PW5gF1x3xg.text: The margs are the best.  Seems like the food is slipping a bit to me.   Stick to the Chopped Salad....its really good.  Their chips....yuck.   But the drinks are great.  Make me very happy.

W_EKiGRHgv5kAscHaAfJkQ.text: I liked this place.  GOOD drinks.  Yeah, I had a lot of margarita's that night.  The food was good too.  I had this scallop appetizer which was incredible.  I guess it better be since it was like an $18 appetizer!!  LMAO  Hey, it was someone else's dime so I don't give a crap.  I don't like that vendor too much anyway.

W_lmeiHkzxO6cOYxakIxgA.text: Z Tejas has been consistently good for me. My favorite dishes are the shrimp tostada bites and catfish tacos. This place is definitely one of the better chains out there. Good margaritas too! Half off all apps during happy hour too, so go there.

LRLqrceLYdBxzuOEJWsctw.text: Solid lunch spot when you want something more than the standard soup, sandwich, salad.  I ordered some chicken medallion / side of potatoes dish and it was really good.  The queso dip was also good, too.

Hr9Nhsnjr6bJYW46khby6g.text: I went here with my parents as we were visiting my grandmother nearby.  The service was some of the best we have ever experienced and the food was amazing too.  My parents and I started with the cornbread which was hot, fresh, and delicious.  For our entrees we shared three things which were all wonderful.  The trout salad had delicious and crispy red trout on top of a delicious salad which had spicy walnuts in them.  We also had both the seafood and mushroom enchilada that were even better!  We don't eat shellfish out, and they were more than willing to take out the small amount of shellfish in it.    My parents also told the waiter it was my birthday coming up and they gave us a complimentary Ancho Fudge Pie with a birthday candle on top.  It was one of the most delicious deserts we ever had and seemed like a perfect cross between a lava cake and brownie.  Plus there is a PokeStop on the premises and as we were about ready to leave, I caught a Pikachu that I renamed Z'Tejachu.  After posting my experience on Facebook and sharing it with others, friends who have lived in the Phoenix and Austin areas also raved about their wonderful experiences at Z'Tejas.

U2QOXc0zeI3VN0E_JbNuLw.text: Horrible service at the bar. Got my drink order right away. But the waitress took 20 min before even coming back to my seat to see if I was eating dinner there.   There are a total of 5 people at the bar and 7 people at the tables around the bar including myself. The waitress walks up to the same 3 tables and talks to the guests but is ignoring me and one other table with two people. The couple next to me are obviously pissed and actually just walked out as I was typing this.  Don't bother coming here.

fEfx1UBvbyvLXOCB2hRHZw.text: Amazing food and service! It was a great way to celebrate my husband's birthday. We loved the Chili con Queso and Miso Salmon! Shelby was so sweet and helpful with the menu. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

ZnWS--0VTXjH9r8pmVw-Zg.text: This is a great place, amazing atmosphere, awesome people, really great vibe overall. The food was excellent and service was great. We had a server named Derek and he was FANTASTIC. Super personal and helpful guy. Will be coming back because of him.

87q7euMQQQfuWqC3FCJeGQ.text: Came here because it's close to my hotel. Service... great!!! Ate here with a coworker last night and had the crispy salmon entree..., super yummy!!! I highly recommend it! Decided to come back tonight by myself. Again, fabulous service at the bar! Got the special soup, roasted poblano and corn. It was ok. Ordered the seafood enchilada. I was really hoping for something fabulous, but really disappointed. I love mushrooms, but they overpowered this dish. Needed more seafood.  Happy hour is great here!!! Love the chamboard margarita!!!

-eLXCRs7RgPrZzm8WlnfMg.text: I order to go fairly often from here. My daughter and I love the nachos. I usually order to go. We ordered the nachos, street tacos, and corn bread. I didn't ask them to separate the nachos so they were soggy by the time we got home. The street tacos weren't impressive. The corn bread was good as always.   I'm not the best at checking my receipts when I get them as was the case this weekend. Today I came across the Z'Tejas receipt in my purse and started reading through it. I noticed there's a To-Go Service Charge and a To-Go Service Charge Tax!! I may be behind on the times but since when do you get charged to take food home? So do I get charged the same fee if I eat and the restaurant and take food home? It could be that I've been charged this before but didn't check the receipt. The mom and pop restaurants I frequent don't charge these fees. I won't be a regular customer of Z'Tejas any longer if I'm charged to order to go. I'm sure I can find some delicious nachos elsewhere.

Hl0CzpTzZNe7F_fsVIptxw.text: BEST FOOD EVER!!! My waiter missie always held a great convo and was very nice to me. Recommended to all

W9_wMoF07EZufDTdJF4jpA.text: Not bad, but not great either. Nice folks, but the food is just "sort of" Mexican and expensive compared to Las Vegas, where I live.

jrfqJAtmqvmQOB5ZddL3fQ.text: I had not been to a Z'Tejas in about 15 years. I was a little surprised that they no longer provide the complimentary cornbread with meals. You can still order it and pay for it (the proceeds go to charity). Instead they bring some thick, cold corn chips with a brown sauce (tastes like a smoked chipolte pureed sauce, not a chunky, fresh Mexican food salsa). My friend and I tried it are not fans of the flavor profile. In the future I need to remember to ask them to not bother bringing this stuff to the table.  I had grilled ruby trout salad with seasoned walnuts, a small blob of feta cheese, mixed greens, and a flavorful dressing. The trout was very good and the overall salad was excellent. The price was $14 which I thought was about twice what it was worth. My friend had the mushroom enchiladas and stated that they were very good ($10).  Service was very good and the food arrived in a timely manner. There are both tables and booths and the noise level is not too bad (normal conversation can be carried on). The restaurant looked clean. It was a pretty typical look and feel for this chain.  Parking is plentiful and the disabled parking is close to the door for the mobility impaired.

KXtrAw-ntvfHS6yR9b_kgQ.text: I was seated and waited more than 5 minutes while others around me who arrived after me were taken care of. I was about to leave when my waiter Tom came up and saved the restaurant from getting a one star. He sincerely apologized about my wait and made my meal enjoyable.  I had the chicken enchiladas which were very good.  Suggestion to management, train to host staff to realize a customer hasn't been taken care of in a short period of time. The hostess past me several times and it didn't register there was a problem.

DORpsZX-T5R8ecCNUXbJLA.text: I used to have not great experiences here but it has recently got better. The service is amazing now. Waiters are all very friendly and food usual comes out in a reasonable time. The food is pretty good as well although it varies depending on the dish. The tacos are amazing but some of the pasta dishes have an odd flavor to them. Overall its a very good place though.

EULbFoMhpa4E_EhXpL8osw.text: They got rid of the Bloody Mary bar. They're dead to me. Although, their jalapeno pancakes are... interesting.

Nfr2V3wfh0vbqd8mbnU7oQ.text: I absolutely love this place it's my favorite restaurant in Arizona! It's also a great place to bring visitors in town. We love sitting at the bar and getting their world-class margaritas! Plus bonus the bartenders are fantastic as well as the waitstaff! We split the tableside guacamole along with the ribeye with blue cheese and caramelized onion sauce and they're both phenomenal! Their z  salad is so amazing for such a simple salad we love it with the red wine vinaigrette dressing! Other dishes we've enjoyed in the past are the Diablo chicken pasta, the chili rellano and the achiote chicken chopped salad! Our favorite margarita has become the paradise where they add extra shot of grand Marnier! Perfect place for a date night or for a fun afternoon happy hour! Love love love  Only downfall would be they seemed to up their prices on both the menu and happy hour... At least get back to good hh prices cause that's a huge draw!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Blue cheese and caramelized onion sauce ribeye steak!! Phenomenal!!

XjQWHar0mQ52thFn71gU4g.text: My husband and I love dining here as they have quick, professional service and the food is always pleasing to the tastebuds. My favorite item on the menu is the wedge salad with skirt steak topped with blue cheese dressing. It's bound to have your tastebuds go wow!

TWFFY5b64cZnb4XNufY52A.text: It's close , usually pretty good , and fast . I have several favorites that I almost always get. The smoked chicken Chile Relleno is always good.  Popped in on a Saturday and  didn't know about the (new?) Brunch thing going on. Oh well, they had some interesting things, so I ordered a dish I had at Crackers Cafe on Elliott - that was super good there. Migas. Scrambled eggs, cheese, jalapeno or some kind of chilie, tortilla chips, all melted together.  Not.  Couldn't really discern where the eggs were, they had to be so dry... The whole thing was dry dry dry. Cheese? What cheese? I saw nor tasted a scrap of cheese.  I ended up eating the potatoes - that were good , but not what id pay 9.50 for.  Pass this weak version and head the Crackers for a delicious take  on it.  But one more thing that really bugged me... The waitress was super sweet  and pretty good ; I did get the wrong muffin delivered, but since I liked both kinds it wasn't that big a deal.  BUT, the cornbread- that used to be free- is now on a donation program: if you "buy" it for $3.00, all proceeds go to a local charity.  Alone, the meal would be big enough. I really wanted no cornbread.  BUT , she spent 30-45 seconds going over it, showing me the card explaining it (on table), And telling me if I couldn't eat it they'd box it up for me! Wow! Really felt pushed to get this $3.00  bread I did not want. I'm ashamed to admit I did order it. And she did box it. And I'll most likely throw is away.  Hey z tehas- show me card- let me read it, and decide on my own. No pressure! I think they may have a contest for who sells more... Sure felt like it.  So, fairly poor quality meal , and $3.00 wasted, while feeling first guilt, then frustration that I caved! Damn.  I won't be back for brunch again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

ZPjyeAGtk5UcSbM2EbBnpQ.text: Great food, amazing service, and fabulous ambiance. Drinks were great and  management did an amazing job catering to our super picky little one!

SlZ-_F6Mt2qEqsqcf1M3DA.text: Great service on the patio. Came for Happy Hour but tequila Tuesday even better! This place is getting hard to find...

6h6WsKv-sZOD2OSn_NBGNA.text: Banana fosters and the enchiladas were tasty :) service could have been a little quicker. Great atmosphere though.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

tkQ_n7uROlu0RkhRyVxTSw.text: Everything here was literally just okay. I was meeting a couple girlfriends here for happy hour before a meeting...as usual I was there on time and had to wait for them...I was quickly seated at a patio table and waited for what seemed about 10 minutes for a waiter...browsed their happy hour menu and wanted to go with the hard day margarita. However, the waiter suggested the chambord as it was the most popular...I agreed and it was good but on the smaller side for a margarita.  Went with the street tacos and catfish beignets as appetizers. The food was bland as if nothing was seasoned.   I would possibly go to a location closer to home for a drink but wouldn't eat there again unless I was maybe trying the entrees and hoping for better.

P7QWCEe0EBBxflzDEAd8Fg.text: Not sure what to expect since we don't have Ztejas in Los Angeles ,  I must say the food AND service was absolutely spectacular.  Although we were a party of 30 people, our servers really took care of us by making sure the chips, salsa and water were being replenished.     Congrats to Kylie and Blaine for such high customer service standards.

NO-meBS1I4E5Y90y-LJEYA.text: I had to give this place three stars as an average of two and four from the two times I have eaten here.  The first time service and food were beautiful. Actually, both times service has been top-notch. Never a problem with service.  I again had the seafood enchiladas which are stuffed with tuna, salmon, spinach, and shrimp. This is really a delicious dish and full of flavor but the second time I had it, every other bite was cold (one hot, one cold, one hot, one cold) - weird. Also, some of the people I was with ordered steaks medium rare. Both came out well. Disappointing.  They do have this different version of a mojito made with pineapple-flavored rum and mint leaves, with brown sugar. It tastes like candy.

PKsVTyC663XdENTIIiwBRw.text: Tonight Z'Tejas let me down. It is unfortunate because I love the food here. I booked a party for six for a reservation at 7:30pm. We were seated right away in the upper level of the restaurant. Our waitress came over right away and took our drink orders. It all started out pretty well.  One of the members of our party had never been here before so he wanted to order three appetizers for us to all share. I recommended the Tejas Trio (queso, salsa and guacamole) and he told our waitress to pick two of her other favorites. Now I understand that he did leave this up to her discretion however, she chose two other items with shrimp and seafood in them. As a waitress I would have maybe considered that not everyone in the party would have liked seafood. I would have understood maybe one other appetizer with seafood but not both. Again, it was left to her discretion so I cannot say too much about this one.  I tried to get her attention two different times to order a margarita, both times she swiftly walked away, maybe I needed to be louder. All things I could have shook off if our meal would have been up to par as it usually is. I had recommended to the other members of our party to order the 21 day aged filet. We had previously had an amazing experience with this steak. Three of us decided to order this item. When they came out they were all New York strip and not filet. Not really that big of deal but when you are a expecting one cut of steak and you receive a different one, it is a little disappointing. My steak was supposed to be a filet topped with a peppercorn crust and topped with a mushroom sauce. It came out as a New York strip, topped with the peppercorn crust but no sauce whatsoever. My dining companions decided to keep the New York strips in lieu of returning them to re-fire filets. I decided to have a filet re-fired because my steak came out completely wrong. I reordered the new steak with the Gorgonzola butter instead of the peppercorn crust because it looked dry when it was brought out.  After waiting fifteen minutes, after all of my dining companions were finished eating, I received my new steak. It was a filet after all but it still came out with the peppercorn crust instead of the Gorgonzola butter. I just feel as though the entire night our waitress did not listen to anything we said. I really am not that picky but after getting all three of our steaks wrong, and getting mine wrong twice I was irritated. This was the place that my fiance and I had recommended to out of town guests and I feel as though it was a big let down tonight. I just do not think our waitress could handle a big party along with serving her other tables.  I still might be back because I know how good the food can be here. I just think we came on an off night. Too bad.

neeXhF6O8UNhoeCvTC1pQg.text: This is probably the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant. We came in at 9:40 and the rest of our party came in at 9:54 to find that the kitchen is closed, despite the fact that the restaurant doesn't close until 10. They were extremely un polite about it and it was blatantly obvious that they were angry. As I work in a restaurant I know that although it might be inconvenient to have customers in so close to closing, it is their JOB to serve us. We had just finished my sisters high school graduation ceremony only to be greeted with rude service. Extremely disappointed, won't be returning.

5vDWguBINkhq044ndR68rg.text: Always loved this place. Especially the corn bread which is the best you can get in town. Get nacho chips with three dip salsa and gauc for appetizers.   Recently had the Fish Tacos and it tasted amazing with pieces of mango and tomato.  For desert: Ancho chili Fudge just makes me dreamy.  If you wanna take a girl to a place with good food and great ambiance this is your spot.

43OBBdqeqBf33Nk6EbMSMQ.text: Joey did a great job in the bar. He was handling the whole bar by himself withe ease. The environment was warm and welcoming. Couldn't hear music very well. Food was good quality and reasonably priced. We will return!

DnMQFfi4DxMRmKftQLgyvA.text: The best Margarita's ever!!! I love their food, and the service is awesome. Always take out-of-state friends & family here to eat because I've never had less than an awesome experience everytime I eat here!!

FFtPiGRrY0obqAFLBGjqWA.text: Awesome food & drinks. Packed Friday night, I can see potential as good place to chill and meet peeps.   I ended up just ordering bunch of appt and drinks since it was biz dinner, turned out perfect with portion of the food.   It's tad noisy for biz lunch / dinner, but service was excellent and will come back again.

Y62bTaf42bqNA8qxN1DhnA.text: Ya I just want to say I love this place!! How could you not? The found is outstanding every time I come in I know I will not be disappointed . Idk maybe it's the margaritas talking  but this place is a must try make sure to start out with the dumplings. The flavors in this dish alone gives them the four . It would be a five no doubt but it is always very loud and the service is a hit or miss. But to a foodie like myself the ambience doesn't  really ruin everything So enjoy over eating over drinking and your left overs in the morning! ( they have awesome portion sizes)

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Street tacos
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dumplings

hAjWKny8oBMCOHXmPppaBA.text: Two out of the four of us got the special.  A $26 filet wrapped in jalapeno bacon.  We ordered them med/well and medium doneness.  When they arrived, we were surprised to see one was med/rare and the other was extremely rare.  The waitress offered to take the food back and have it cooked longer.  We respectfully declined.  We didn't feel comfortable sending food back into the kitchen.  Otherwise, the vegetables and potatoes were tasty.  The other meals were fair as well.

PzGHFxT_uJoJyObAzFilaA.text: Went there twice this week for Happy Hour. Once to the Chandler location and once to the Scottsdale Mall location. I've eaten at both locations a few times over the past year as well.  Food: Very good. Always good flavor with being gratuitously spicy. Mushroom enchiladas are my favorite meal. I've tasted EVERY appetizer and they are all very satisfying. Good portion size for an app, which makes the happy hour prices all the more attractive!   Drinks: Happy Hour Drink prices are quite high compared to other HH's. Otherwise, I guess they're pretty much in line. The Chambourd Frozen Margarita is delish!  Service: Never had a bad experience with the wait staff. Friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Seem to be perfectly okay with their tables ordering off the HH menu (some servers don't like the small tabs and it's reflected in their performance). Like I said, not a problem here (IME).  So this place always was one of our favorites and will continue to be until something changes.

_Edg4aq_-Kb2fwlA1BkJgg.text: Go there for happy hour, chambord margs and green chile pork verde, all there appetizers are dope!

NVuapxkUNpPQuxTw02gf4g.text: Made reservation because had other engagements. Showed up and waited twenty minutes. They said sorry people who have your table haven't left yet. As if they only have one table. When we informed them of our time constraints. They made no offer to help out. Like the food but not so good at keeping the reservation. And really that's the most important part

VbZNr6borbjHl4yrH-rrwQ.text: Let's be clear, I'm giving 4 stars because of the awesome, yummy and STRONG chambord margaritas!  Love them!  You only need 2 of these delectable delights to get your blood flowing (really, you only need 1).  The food alone would get a solid 3 stars for me -- consistently decent, but not great.  I usually get the street tacos or the tostada bites when I go for happy hour.    Happy hour on Fridays is always packed.  Get there early to get seating in the bar!

S2X2YhRa1jNo8oRPtTrsVw.text: In my book, and the collective book that my friends are forced to share with me, Z-Tejas is synonymous with fun. How do you make it a good night? Follow my directions carefully: 1) flag over your waiter or any other waiter (or anyone that looks like a waiter) in your vicinity 2) say the following "6th street, frozen, salt" 3) drink 4) repeat  Seriously though, the margaritas are excellent. I haven't tried any other drinks here, but I'm fairly certain they'd be just as good (okay maybe not as good, but close enough).  The food is tasty too. Don't go in expecting authentic Mexican. I don't know why you'd go into a snazzy place called Z-Tejas for authentic food anyway, but that's between you and your brain. The Diablo Chicken Pasta is awesome. The Jerk Chicken Salad is excellent too. I have friends who get the Pork Medallions, and they seem to love it.  If you go and see a large group that's being loud ... look for the devilishly handsome Indian dude and come say hello. Okay I'm kidding, I don't even live in PHX anymore.

u_63jKypywBboEQXnzHY8g.text: Service was best part of our meal experience. Pork tenderloin was over cooked, mixed veggies were flavorless, trout was dry and overcooked as was the salmon. Very disappointed as I know they can do better.

ZAAsE_w4UjcxfGKJZlmmVQ.text: Food was great servers were good but the manager was unacceptably rude. I figured after ordering 120$ worth of food in this restaurant. And being the one who payed for it I would have been treated better. Not sure what his name was but he was taller with glasses and a receding hair line. I won't be going back to this place any more. At least not this location.

nTdq6pZNugAmas3OquAfYg.text: Outstanding food and service! We had a large party for brunch, but the waitress handled everyone's request with ease. The service was fantastic; the food came out quickly, and accurately. Everything was delicious and the make your own drink bar was original and fun. I will be back!

1N2jWrUBEJC0xXwQuleVow.text: If you gave Z any less than 4 stars - you've just never had one of their fab margaritas!  My favorite is the Cha-Mango (chambord and mango mixed).  But let me not get ahead of myself....  I don't live in a city with a Z'Tejas anymore, so I always make sure to stop in when I'm in Phoenix.  Before you go, just note, it's TEX-MEX, not Mexican food.  There is a difference and you have to know what you're getting into.  My favorite dishes are the baked seafood enchiladas and the jerk chicken salad.  They also bring you cornbread (with real corn in it) while you wait for your meal.  Z always goes above and beyond when it comes to customer service, so you never have to worry when you come in - you'll ALWAYS be taken care of!

FbHFkSIbGsay5cr6SkUCfg.text: Great food as usual. I brought my parents here for the first time. They really liked it. My only complaint was the noise level. Wow! Right next to the bar screaming across the table to each other or the server. My hard of hearing dad just tuned out because he heard nothing but bar laughter and chatter. Next time a table far from the bar....

26acF-0448S9ILu-m3bXhA.text: As I live close to this location I am a frequent visitor. And every visit has proven to be a great one. The staff is always friendly and appear to be working hard. The food is always prompt and delicious. I almost always order the Fish Street Tacos and they NEVER disappoint. The queso is always a favorite too. Although I tend to pass on their guacamole. And if you're a margarita lover then you must try the Fusion Frozen Margarita. They top it off with fruit infused Patron and it is refreshing and strong! Don't have more than 3! I would always recommend this location to any friends and family!

868CSlJAgFmLc2wXQ535Fw.text: Pretty good! I ordered the Voo Doo Tuna and it was awesome. I loved the ginger and sauce with the fish. The veggies were well cooked as well and so was the fish. Thought it would be raw but was lightly cooked. Overall really great. Loved the cornbread as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Voo Doo Tuna

b889DRUHUeGTAUN6DxBbhQ.text: This place is great for anyone who's single the bar area stays packed. If your going here to eat with a friend or family member you may get a bit irritated. The noise level of this place is ridiculous (it maybe the super high ceiling and seating in an open area) you would have to sit close or yell out your convo to one another. The food is average I find myself asking for extra sauce and the menu changes so much you can really keep a favorite unless you eat here every other day. My waitress Maria was a sweet heart. Her customer service made my experience at lot better.

8CttHO-LhICXnzFOgME58g.text: Terrible food. Were the steak tacos supposed to be purely made of steak fat? To top it off, got charged for a beer that I took two sips of and sent back. Will not be going back.

Qv7c3qsK2EM8-uMRJFEYkA.text: My husband and I came to Z'Tejas to try the famous chambord margaritas and some yummy dinner entrees but were turned away at the door. We walked in the door at 8:45 PM tonight (9/4/16) and were told by the employees at the door that the manager, Tom, had closed the restaurant already. The only problem is that Z'Tejas' website states that they are open until 9:00. Why couldn't we come in to get a quick bite and a quick drink? Also, if the restaurant was closed, why wasn't the door locked to let customers walking in know that the restaurant was closed. Not impressed and very disappointed with the manager at this location and we will not be back!!!

_LI_IgOvSk3B3wceUwprSg.text: Food was excellent, environment very nice.  Music alittle loud, however.  Our waiter was rather rude to begin with, but seemed to regret it quickly and behaved himself for the rest of our meal.  I can recommend this place.  I was going to give them only 3 and a half stars, but my wife talked me into 4.

QaXEvwgaWiKnwLeEsRkjOA.text: I visit this place every time I come to town. The atmosphere is nice, staff is always friendly and I love Happy Hour. Food and their famous Margarita I absolutely love

nsMp7fAdYl-hlqe_RTMX1Q.text: it was, okay. the food was not spicy, not flavorful and not a full portion. the happy hour margarita was more mix than tequila. the best thing I can say is the food was quick to the table. we didn't get a refill on water or cockle or hot tea.

T3bAcOaG1W4TtJ1swA_GtQ.text: I love this place for meetings! There is just enough buzz to keep things relaxed and a professional enough atmosphere to hold meetings at.

FA-ijbAfHjmaXVFm3-opiA.text: The cornbread here is an amazing appetizer. My family and I always come for happy hour and we always enjoy the service. My personal favorite is the smothered chicken burrito. The chicken is very flavorful and I always look forward to going back to get more.

ZXcekufoATVJHtEZmDa8BQ.text: Very good food, superb bartender, and very tasty margaritas. Great happy hour prices!  First time I was here for lunch with my husband I had the blackin catfish taco. Excellent. And my husband had the z burger n loved it. Sexing time I came with my son for happy hour and we had street tacos. Very good also.

V0V3d6gVmqMYz_TDXeSCKA.text: My rating is based on this first review... not on the second.  On my first visit to Z Tejas, I went at lunchtime with 2 guys from Boeing.  We had to sit at the bar since the restaurant was so crowded.  As I scanned the menu, the Grilled Green Chile Pork Enchiladas with green chile sauce and a tomato-avocado chopped salad caught my eye... and I'm glad it did.  I dont necessarily consider myself an 'enchilada' type of guy, but this dish provided me with the best I've ever tasted.  I recommend this dish, with no reservations.  Now for my second review.  My boss and I headed to Z Tejas today.  I figured that I'd mix it up and try something new.  Bad choice.  I was feeling a bit famished, so I ordered the more expensive menu item, which was Jack's Five-Cheese Macaroni Achiote.  The grilled chicken with bleu, Jack, cheddar, parmesan and romano cheeses and bacon gratin sounded like a complete winner.  Where to begin?  The dish incorporates real cheese, which I would normally find appetizing.  However, in this case, the entree was served piping hot, causing the cheese to string everywhere.  Kind of messy for a lunchtime meal.    So, I ate slow, in hopes that the threadlike curd would solidify some.  Well, it did, but it also left, what can only be depicted as an oily scramble, in the bottom of the bowl, due to separation.  Delectable!  Well, I decided to ease up on the 'roni, and move on to the chicken, which was served with skin on.  Visually, the skin looked crispy... but I realized my peepers were punked when I chewed up on some rubbery epidermis.  Swoop Says: skip the mac 'n cheeze, go for the whole enchilada!  In other news, the server at the bar was top notch.  She refilled my palmer again and again, until my bladder shouted: 'Uncle!'.  When you need some pampering, saddle up to the bar.  BIRTHDAY BONUS: Signup for their birthday club and get an annual $10 coupon in your email.  ~Swoop

XhfpWj23cf781wTOWbwv8Q.text: Z'Tejas has great margaritas (DUH), a great wine list and great food.  The atmosphere is awesome and I have never had an issue with service whether dining in the bar or in the dining room.  They are even nice enough to customize my margarita with jalapenos when I go there.  You'd think it wouldn't be that hard for a Mexican/Margarita joint but I have a hard time getting that request fulfilled at several places around PHX.  Bottom line, this is a great place for a date, a friendly get together or even lunch!!  The food will get you in the door and the cocktails and ambiance will get you coming back.

HQOmSCX0bMUBfEYTA1Pi_g.text: Love this place! Jerk chicken salad is to die for!  And the Chambord margaritas are delicious! Great service!

iQ3vBKWz8eUQnoQRnFYd8w.text: Two words: Chambord Margarita  I used to not even like margarita's, Z Tejas changed my outlook on tequila.    The food is great too.  My usual favorites are the shrimp & guac tostada bites to start then move on to the artichoke chicken stack for dinner, and cornbread of course.  I've also tried the smoked chicken enchiladas and loved em.  Sunday morning brunch I have to have my egg hash...and a margarita :)

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Chambord Margarita

LHhQg6LHoA-zXvL0jiOR4g.text: Went here on a date night with the wifey and was very pleased with our service and the food! The corn bread is delicious! And our meals were both really good!

nHvXBf3cqVMeiBZto_cDsw.text: Had a buisness dinner here last night. I was impressed the food selection was good. Good appetizers and good service. The setup inside was good. I need to come back and try the happy hour specials. I had the seafood enchilada which was good. I WILL BE BACK!

TRYWS6lF4VSBiEtCMuJt7w.text: This place has the best happy hour ever. I highly recommend the pork nachos. They are delicious and a steal at happy hour. The atmosphere is fun but can be a little loud.  The open layout is nicely done though.

i27laZOFZ3PyW0ItUmZy_g.text: Matt from Virginia with 2 kids was one of the best servers I've ever had. He was considerate and excelled at customer service. The food at Z is excellent. I had the achiote chicken Cobb salad. Its my default meal here. Bloody Mary bar is top notch in this area.

CwZQ94P4RMlEEI3G7pX04w.text: Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. There were 12 of us and our waiter took great care of us in spite of the group size. We asked for separate checks and he didn't show any signs of an attitude at all. At the end, when our checks came some of us realized he had forgotten to charge us for our sodas. When we pointed it out to him, he brushed it off and said, "If it's not on the bill, it won't be there at all. Don't worry about it!" Now if only all our waiters can forget about charging us for alcoholic beverages...  As for the food, my favorite was the free corn bread. Fresh from the oven, piping hot, sweet, with whole kernels of corn baked in and served in a mini baking pan. I could have eaten an entire pan of it and called it a night. In hindsight, that's what I should have done. The birthday girl suggested I try the Grilled Miso Salmon since she knows I LOVE seafood, adding that it was "pretty decent salmon considering we're in the middle of the desert." I'll also admit I'm not a big fan of Mexican food. Well, let's just say I'm sure there can be better salmon found in the middle of the desert than at Z'Tejas. The salmon was overcooked even though I asked for medium rare. The mashed potato cake on the side was just a lump of dry mashed potato that tasted like it was leftover and sitting in the fridge since last Thanksgiving. I definitely should have gone with a salad or Mexican dish.

lNMS3MztmOB9RNnhAa_P4A.text: One word. Cornbread. Several more....  This place was awesome. I'm not one for chains, but I am one for strong drinks, good food, and my awesome friends.  Last night, I met up with friends at Z's. Had a long week at work, so I figured, let's go balls to the wall.  The Vodka Sodas are remarkably strong. Typically at chains, you get a few drops of vodka flavoring. These were NO JOKE. Leave your amateur cards at home.  The ahi tuna appetizer, pulled pork nachos, and the cornbread were enough to change my life, both physically and emotionally. Yeah, that damn good. I won't write about the cornbread, because I want you to try it for yourself....write a Yelp review...and then give me credit. While you are at it, give my friend and fellow Yelper Sarah W. credit as well, because she is the one that turned me on to it.  Want a Mojito that will open your mind to a higher power? Try the Tropical Guava Mojito. Guava rum, X-rated fusion liqueur, monin mojito, mint, lime, soda and sprite. Yeah.   Like I said....happy hour on a friday was balls to the wall.  Get some. This is the spot. Thank God there is one in Scottsdale.

GER9cPfPknXBCYk7THbVjg.text: Stopped in for happy hour tonight with several friends.   Have been here several times over the last year,  had good experiences, and were looking forward to the visit.   Disappointed this time.   First,  the draft beer served was not chilled.   The server noted that the glasses had just been put into the cooler  and that might have affected the temp of the beer, and she recommended we try a bottled beer instead.   Second, a member in our party has a seafood allergy.   In the past, servers have recommended foods that would be very safe, and not likely to be cross contaminated.   Our server tonight wouldn't give any assurances at all.    We asked to speak to the chef and he/she never came out to discuss our concerns.   We won't be going back.

iwM1bKvgv9V-0jT0us73VA.text: Upscale fusion Mexican food. Everything we tried was delicious and well presented. Definitely, a "go to" destination.

92QjhcA8zHiTLTn-nSLuKw.text: So one of our favorite little spots.  Great service as usual.  A little disappointed to see they now charge for cornbread.  Used to be free.  They allowed me to order my Diablo pasta even though it wasn't on the lunch/brunch menu which was awesome.  I tried it with shrimp this time.  Couldhave used a few more shrimp (had maybe 5) and more spice, but overall very good.  My GF had the steak burrito.  She gives it a solid C.  Sauce a little salty and the burrito is drenched in sauce and cheese.  Not a traditional burrito.  The steak inside was flavorful and rice and black beans were good.  She said she wouldn't order it again though.  Our server was awesome!  Super friendly and prompt.  Gave good reccommedations.  Very happy with the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Diablo pasta, yes please!

M6qI1cXffH9QiK97s-n4Dg.text: Z'Tejas has the best Chambord Margaritas!  Good specials and Happy Hour prices.  A shout out to the best waiter, Tom, and the best Bartender, Matt, in town.  Free chips and Salsa, and 1 free pan of yummy cornbread.  And a very big menu.

9kmKsGsz-0l9jl7ldB1wQg.text: I just spoke with a manager this morning about an interesting experience last night at Z Tejas. The food was good. The queso dip would probably taste better and more authentic if it weren't made with American cheese. The guac was not salted. However, our entrees were good and I cleaned my plate. Love the free cornbread. Our waiter was very charismatic with us and we immediately thought, wow! What a great waiter! We thought that he was very nice and professional, even though our entrees arrived really fast, before our chips and dip (not even a big deal). That is when it seems like things took a turn for the worst.   Mid conversation, myself and a friend were very suddenly distracted by an extreme screaming match going on right next to us in the kitchen. It was so loud and clear. My first thought was, jeez I hope our waiter isn't being yelled at -- then, after a quick glance, I realized that the person who was yelling was actually our waiter! Our jaws dropped. The restaurant would get quiet as the screaming commenced. The employees nervously paced and darted their eyes around. Whoever was being yelled at in the kitchen seemed to try to defend themselves, but the waiter was so relentless. We sat there eating, talking, and very frequently stopping to listen to the drama.   I hate that I am leaving this review. However, the manager told me this morning that he would be emailing me. I haven't received that email yet. My friend and I who visited the restaurant work very hard, and it is not easy to just fork over $80 for a couple drinks, dinner and chips with dip... let alone listen to people be berated when we are just trying to chill! I hope to hear from management soon via email like promised. We want to come back because our entrees were fabulous, but last night was just downright unacceptable and unprofessional! We will go to another location if the Ray location is too problematic. Sad times.

RPqA8P6Lmd8Obh1c9nQ6eA.text: I took my family here for lunch on Sunday. I have never seen more fruit flies in a restaurant in my life.  It was absolutely disgusting.  We will not be going back!

MhPO78VS3-eWIU3rNHrE8g.text: Great vibe, decent service and food was alright. I had the green chile barbacoa enchiladas. They were average, the black beans were tasty, the cojita cheese was a great topping. The rice tasted like it came from a box - needs a lot of work. I also tasted the steak fajitas. The steak was surprisingly good as it was tender, juicy, and seasoned well.
