-McdkIDBLhVuuFJlMg9Uww.text: Great services tonight at this local joint. The chambord margaritas are incredible and our server was attentive and responsive! Thank you for great service and food!!!

HRs9sPCMizxMtTK_gbOn-A.text: I love this place. One of my go-to spots.  Try the catfish beignets....they are awesome.  They have a very nice weekend brunch with breakfast selections that are unique.

nCKA5yLRY7ur0nFtWoToFA.text: Absolutely hands down one of the best dinning experiences!!!!! I have eaten at five star restaurants where the bill was over $600 and I was never treated with more kindness, respect, and hospitality then from Jeff the manager at Z'Tejas. Each staff member from the host to Don our waiter was friendly, quick to remove plates and fill up drinks. Jeff made the entire experience one that will keep us coming back!! As soon as he found out my wife and I were new to the restaurant, he did everything and anything to make sure our experience was a great one. We are truly blown away and walked out with how we felt like royalty from this establishment.  This is a legit review. I have never met any of the staff before tonight but felt like family.   Thanks Jeff, Dom and the entire Z'Tejas team!!!!

1Ma-Arleq8f3f4tQYMLTRA.text: Great Mexican restaurant that has been around for over 25years.  Food was spectacular margaritas were even better and the se vice and servers were cute.

B-zu50E2y6SdSMP4FTuo-Q.text: Beyond disappointed tonight. Poor service, poor food, crumbs for chips.  Felt invisible as we sat for over thirty minutes with one glass of water after asking for the bill. Staff was arrogant, non attentive, did not take responsibility and was not apologetic for the many mishaps. Perhaps these folks need to remember they are in a service business. With so many other places to choose from, I will not be returning. I can't remember the last time I complained about a restaurant. This was too much to go unsaid.

sLa2FR1_6BUwgCtG_nk3-A.text: Excellent customer service! Great margaritas and cornbread to start off with. Salmon was perfectly cooked and vegetables were colorful, flavorful, and fresh. We sat outside and enjoyed a great relaxing lunch. Plan to come back!!!

ZS6mwkngllUbQmLDOW7Oag.text: Had a chance to go there for happy hour tonight on a Wednesday. I had the Tejas Mule. ''Twas good. Also had the catfish bites. They were very good as well. Great atmosphere and the GM actually came to check on us at our table. He was super personable and has quite a vision for the future of Z'Tejas. UCL thanks for being so nice and all the staff was amazing and fast. Definitely will come back!!!  And yes this is Dana White!

_F4R3nvfzi-A3_S4HrH1lg.text: Upper level Mexican food. Very flavorful. Large portions! The environment was loud. I had the chicken diablo with shrimp and it was delicious .

yEeB7CsxiI8N9BqWJr4bxg.text: This is my favorite place to go for lunch. Especially the bartenders. They are all fabulous,  however Phil, is especially outstanding. He is funny. Phil makes it a fun place.

yRs_OOGw1_ph7VJbhoXjsw.text: OK...so it's been 5 years.  I don't come here often, obviously!  We had a company lunch on this occasion.  The place was pretty full, and very loud.  Surprising how loud.  I ordered the steak burrito.  When it arrived it wasn't very hot.  Our orders were called in ahead of time, and we arrived punctually.  There were probably 15 of us, and they had the orders ready almost instantly.  Given the temperature I would say they cooked it well ahead.  My burrito must have been sitting around for (I would guess) 30 minutes to get that not-warm.  So how did it taste?  The flavor was not bad.  Pretty good, really.  The rice that came with it was seasoned very well, I thought.  But the steak in the burrito was a bit fatty and gristle-y.  I expect better quality meat at Chipotle or Cafe Rio, and I certainly expect better here!  All I can say is I'm glad I didn't pay the $13.50 for that burrito.  Yes, that's how much the lunch menu steak burrito cost!  If it was $7 I probably would bump to three stars.  Flavor was good, and temperature would probably have been fine if it wasn't a pre-order for a large group.  So I'll give them those.  Well, at least the benefit of the doubt on the temperature.  But the fat and gristle, plus the portion size (which was small) do not warrant a $13.50 price tag!  At that price the value just isn't there for what you get.  Service was good, especially considering the size of our group.  If there ever is a next time I will have to try something completely different.  For a burrito I could get one at Chipotle for $9 that is twice the size and almost as flavorful.

kgzK-PYFWwUIcUhlzPipJA.text: Good not great.  The wife and I came for a bite at happy hour.  We sat on the patio, which was more quiet than I'd have expected based on proximity to the road.   The margarita's were really good but not the best in the area, which may keep us from going back.  Chips and queso were really solid and so was the quesadilla.  Happy hour pricing wasn't bad but wasn't great either.   TLDR - Good spot but probably not the best in the area for what we are looking for.  Definitely worth a try though.

_HCndrUrR4aAbkpp479ShA.text: Dinner tonight was a win in all respects.... began with some perfect Margarita's and then on to dinner... the filet was cooked perfectly and seasoned very well, the Crispy Salmon was just what I needed, the Ancho Fudge Pie... a perfect ending to a great meal. We met the GM, Chris, a most personable guy who is doing a great job with this establishment and with whom we spoke at length regarding all the changes he's been making. He made us comfortable and looking forward to our next visit.

15qB1iUv8STGZ6R42F82gA.text: We had high hopes for this restaurant....the ones in Texas were great.  First off they are out of the draft beer we ordered from a very limited selection and ordered iced tea which was hard to distinguish from water....just terrible...sent it back. The replacement was slightly better. Dinner was ordinary.  Our server was quite goodNot a place we will visit again.

84aReIaa68LuqsODLUkMxg.text: Interesting food.. My favorite is the Mushroom enchillada and my husband loves the chile rellano, my granddaughter loves the Miso Salmon.. Great variety

e60uibUCdZTXPaPVSrrhxA.text: Thought the steaks were incredible and we weren't really expecting them to be.  Overall atmosphere was lively and fun.  Bar could be bigger, but still overall a very nice place and recommend.

rLnELefbQkc2VIaOcelqNw.text: GREAT PLACE!!!!  Love the happy hour when I can make it.....  The street tacos are fantastic.   My family and I haven't had anything we wouldn't eat again here.  The bartenders are Awesome!

Tfq1Z3p2GNNEpVMTzUUWxA.text: Four stars for amazing (but slightly pricey) food, with a bonus star for excellent customer service by manager Brad.    After a day of yard work, we decided we wanted a great dinner, but didn't feel like getting ready and going out...take out from Z'Tejas it is!  Z'Tejas is one of the few restaurants whose take out food is just as good as their restaurant food.  They pack many of the ingredients separately so that everything is fresh and the correct temperature.  The steak for the steak salad is packed separately, the tortilla strips and cheese are packed separately from the soup.   Even though it costs them more to pack everything, it definitely keeps the integrity and flavor of the food.   Starter - Bowl of chicken tortilla soup.  The soup has great flavor, but was mostly broth. The chicken that was included was delicious big chunks of white meat.  It came with a side of tortilla strips and cheese (didn't get the typical lime and avocado that usually comes with it - a little disappointing).   Entree 1 - Diablo Pasta (vegetarian version) - I love they have vegetarian options for many of their popular dishes.  The pasta was wonderfully creamy and spicy!   Entree 2 - Red Chile Mango Salad - This salad is SOO good.  It has delicious spicy walnuts, tangy blue cheese, tender and tasty grilled steak and mango dressing.  The flavors blend together so perfectly.  This is one of the meals that you crave!  Aside from their chicken artichoke stack (my other fave!), this is usually all I order here.  I just can't go and not experience the perfectly balanced flavor combo.    This visit - I was actually given the wrong dressing for my salad.  Instead of the wonderfully sweet mango dressing that accents the spicy and tangy ingredients...it was a warm sweet dressing with a heavy red onion flavor.  Not a  good match! :(   After trying to make due and tough it out I just couldn't do it.  The thing I love about this salad is the way the sweet dressing perfectly complements the other ingredients.  Hubby called them and spoke with manager Brad.  He immediately offered to remake my salad and comp the meal.  I would have been happy with either one (leaning toward re-making the salad as I REALLY wanted to experience the flavors, but didn't want hubby to have to drive back over there).  Comping the meal made up for the extra trip AND I got to enjoy my favorite salad    This is why Z'Tejas is one of our favorites!!!  Excellent food and EXCELLENT customer service.  We will be back!!!  Thanks Brad!

AX9R2nr_EcJRhVkX0jMHEg.text: The service is inconsistent, but the food is always good - so I'm a fan.   To elaborate, the menu is an interesting mix of Tex-mex Americana. They have enchiladas on the menu and right next to it a plain ol' burger!   All their salads are great! And, I'm not a girl who "craves" salads. If I'm going to crave anything it will be peppered french fries. But, man, I crave the z-Tejas Jerk Chicken Salad. Slightly spicy grilled jerk-spiced chicken (spicy and jerked is redundant) with roma tomatoes, feta cheese, tortilla strips (which I omit), salad and a spicy creamy dressing (which I always have them put on the side).  If the description sounds to spicy for you, then try the Pecan Crusted Chicken Spinach Salad as it is awesome as well.   Next time you are out on Ray Road or maybe coming back from Holiday shopping at Chandler Mall, stop by and try Z-Tejas. But for full disclosure, their service could be hit or miss. Ok- I've gotta run....I have a craving....

Jw8BrwypRtXbU1vCcWQIOQ.text: My girlfriend and I love this place. It's clean and the staff are friendly. And of course, the food is great. Try the avocado chicken sandwich, the bread is phenomenal!

_LyPPAsSytniBmAGYOOsgg.text: We went here for lunch today with the padres as they are in town for a couple weeks.  The place was dead at 1 p.m. on a Wednesday afternoon during some school's spring break.    We were seated promptly.  Z'Tejas carries the Republic of Tea drinks, so some of us ordered Pomegranite, I ordered the decaf Ginger Peach.  They served us a skillet cornbread (guess that is their specialty "bread basket" )  For lunch I had the cup of soup: Gumbo was on the chef's soup special today.  The broth was thick, the sausage was spicy, the chicken was tender and there was just enough rice to consider it a gumbo.  I also had the Z' salad which was a small mixed leaf lettuce with tomato, green and red bell pepper, parmesean cheese and their own string like crutons.  I got the ginger vinegrette on the side.  It was just enough to fill me up, but not make me unbutton my pants. LOL.  The rest of the group had variations of enchiladas: mushroom, chicken and cheese.  The lunch plate size is very good, and included rice and choice of beans.  I am glad restaurants are finally sizing DOWN the portions!  I am tired of doggy-bags that sit in the fridge only to be tossed out.

sB3UAuKJ4B5u4agwQyhD_Q.text: Went there today for the Sunday Brunch. So good!!!! I have food allergies and the manager, Jennifer was so helpful in making sure that I received the correct plate. I am in the restaurant industry and it was wonderful to see how much she cares about her guests!!! We will definitely be back again, and again!!! Great food, drinks, atmosphere and service!!!

4Dtygr9J9gTsl2qJGpsgwA.text: Oh Z, how do I love thee.  Let me count the ways.  1. LOVE your margaritas.  Seriously.  I'm not a fan of tequila and/or margaritas generally speaking, but I love Z's margaritas.  Especially the Chambord and Prickly Pear.   Be warned though - they're VERY dangerous.  2. SALSA!  I love it!  They also have an appetizer with a variety of 3 salsas, but honestly, their original is the best.  The chips are good too - light and crispy.  3. EVERYTHING on the menu.  Not kidding.  I haven't had anything I didn't like at Z.  My faves include: catfish tacos, Jerk Chicken salad, Diablo Pasta, Wild Mushroom enchiladas, Mac & Cheese w/o bacon, the trout, seriously, the list could go on and on.  My mouth is watering.  I think you get the point.  Go to Z.  ASAP.

HmOaTQYmzVyj_CV0U7bSeQ.text: I'm kind of middle of the road when it comes to Z.  I think they're OK for happy hour, though their drinks aren't that great of a deal, but you don't need too many either.  Ada G. is addicted to their Chambord Margaritas and recreates them at home for us too.  As for their other food.  I've had a salad I liked and some apps were good but I've generally been a little disappointed with the rest.  My friend B's husband used to be a bartender at Scottsdale so once upon a time, we put in many Friday nights at the bar, sampling the wares.  Nowadays I just go for a "normal" happy hour and I'm not having to drive back to her house Sunday afternoon to get my car.  I'd have to say it's a much kinder, gentler approach.  Try them for happy hour.  Sit on the patio, enjoy the weather (unless it's summer) and have a margarita and some tostada bites.  I think you'll enjoy it.

zHV30aqCleP8p_KhJmAYig.text: I haven't been to Z'Tejas in years.  So when a date asked if I wanted to meet there, I thought what a great idea, now I'll totally have something to Yelp about!  We met at 6 pm on a Saturday night, and while clearly busy, it only took them 10 minutes to seat us.  The restaurant was nicely laid out, plenty of room between tables, and I didn't feel like I was crammed in a corner.  The noise level was perfect too, something that is missing from so many places.  Our server was friendly and quick, and answered menu questions with suggestions and good information. I ended up ordering the 5 Cheese Macaroni & Cheese, and my date got the El Diablo chicken.  Both were pasta dishes, but very different.  The mac & cheese was gooey and tasty, and very filling - no appetizer and I could not finish my plate.  I really wanted to - the bacon on the top was the perfect touch.  My date's chicken and pasta was spicy, but not overwhelming - subtle flavors playing out nicely together.   The portions were large enough that I couldn't even think about dessert, and was so glad we passed on an appetizer.  Overall it was a great meal, and I would have given them 5 stars, if it wasn't a chain restaurant.

s-aglsUzYmnfjrRhvJaWJw.text: I had Smoked Chicken Chile Relleno  and I thought I had died and went to heaven!  It was so great.  The waiter was knowledgeable and very helpful.  Food was so great, served hot, great presentation.  I wanted spicy, but the other person I was with wanted mild.  She loved it, and so did I.  This was my first visit, but not my last.

EERUXEQtq1dudA92O-6ztg.text: I didn't know Z'Tejas had multiple locations until this past weekend.  I had been to the one in Tempe ages ago, and an associate swore by the one at Tatum.  We happened to meet up at the Chandler location.  Everyone obsesses about the cornbread, but I don't love cornbread.  That's okay because the dip trio is amazing - guacamole, queso, and salsa.  The chicken enchiladas are very popular here, and it is probably because the chicken is smoked/roasted beforehand, so it has a nice flavor.  I ordered a salmon salad, and I loved it.  I normally don't like mixed greens, but I highly recommend it.  It was abnormally spicy for a spicy salad though.  It's so interesting because I feel like Z'Tejas is almost like a Valley version of Cafe Poca Cosa (Tucson); it has the same kind of vibe without all the hype.  Sort of a ritzy Southwestern take on Mexican food.  I am a fan, but the service was abnormally slow and confused when I went there.

qwtTecRBjGKUuBBSJuzx_w.text: Four stars for delicious margaritas and cornbread. I wasn't a fan of the mexican food here, to be honest.  I did enjoy the pork tenderloin stuffed with sausage though!

N6Aw5EfHYGz3zpIkP5MY4A.text: Ive lived in ahwatukee my whole life and have been to ztejas years ago but my experience a couple days ago truly shows what i was missing out on. I forgot the servers name but he was a tall younger man with long hair. He did have a red pocket square and looked like the only one with one on (very nice touch to the plain black uniforms by the way) My fiance and I are not really big Margarita drinkers but he recommended the chambord blended margarita and it was ammaaziinnggg. We had the queso appetizer which was delicious! I ordered the shrimp and chicken diablo pasta (by our servers recommendation again)  and the plate was prepared perfectly! I usually go to oreganos for this similar plate but ztejas blows them out of the water! The place and bathrooms looked very clean also. Everything from the food to the service and the cleanliness was on point! I really wish i rememberd the servers name so he could receive  acknowledgement for his great service. We will be returning!!

1-kRmsT2SG7OM9IG6wTDSg.text: Ya know, I almost thought about giving Z-Tejas five stars just for having a separate, gluten-free menu, but I just couldn't bring myself to do it because the service was way below what I expect when I eat out.  We, a party of five (including my parents, who were visiting from Scotland), were initially seated at a really cramped table when several booths were open. Remedied this by asking to be moved to one of them. In addition, we didn't receive a kids' menu until we had waited around for about 20 mins. So, picture this, I have a hyper kid on my hands because his blood sugar levels are low and he's ready to chew his own arm off as well as those of everyone else surrouding him. Great... I will say that a very large party (around 20 people) was seated nearby and our server was one of many attending to their every need.  Our server had an excuse; he was new to the establishment and still in training. He was very cordial and was trying his best to deal with my gluten-free requirements. Turns out he wasn't given any training on the menu, with which he was very unfamiliar. Great...way to instill confidence that I'm not going to have a gluten-related "episode." Let me be clear, I don't blame him for this whatsoever. My hat goes off to him for trying. What got me was the dirty look I received from one of the female servers...WTF! What did I ever do to her. Message to her: You're in the wrong line of work, lady. Try collections or repossessions. I almost handed her back my gluten-free steak and vegs. My give up...  The food, when it did finally arrive, was good, albeit a little bland in my case. Why the heck people think gluten-free food has to taste bland is beyond me. I wish Gordon Ramsay would come in and rescue kitchens from their gluten-free nightmares. My parents both enjoyed their meals; they ordered the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and green beans. My son enjoyed his cheeseburger, but then what kid doesn't? And, my husband enjoyed his seared ahi tuna steak, but felt the portion size was a little on the small side (he's a big guy).   Next time, I'll try the chambord margarita. I don't think I can go wrong with that -- at least it's alleged to taste good and it's gluten-free. =) I will, however, be checking out the restaurant in Tempe and not coming back to the one in Chandler.

qFDoQMo-CQ6gD7kpnS-VUg.text: With the interesting ingredients and combinations listed on the menu, we had expected to be dazzled by the flavors.  Unfortunately, the flavors were very bland and the only dominant one was chipotle.  Chipotle is overdone and overrated in our opinion.  Really expected some unique delicious food and were disappointed.

O0tSbkljUd4w2FV2iXPOHg.text: Went here a few weeks ago for brunch. I will say that I am still a fan of Z Tejas but I think I just ordered the wrong thing. I had the potato hash and eggs which was ok but it seemed like it needed something more flavor wise. Maybe a little more sauce on top would have made it better. Also, since I was sick, I ordered the tortilla soup. It was a thick soup and I actually prefer brothier tortilla soups. Wasn't bad though. As always, the cornbread was phenomenal. I also had a red sangria and it was delicious and refreshing. My companion said that she loved her burger and fries. I still love Z Tejas but I will probably just go for dinner there from here on out since that is where they really shine.

OruUb6vQb_PQ2-PkLxEC3g.text: um, no. Group dinner here was terribly bland. Wine and food disappointed izquierda y deracha. This is the Olive Garden of Phoenix.

ySIvjEfKjDiFZdI51ZqEpg.text: After about a year of the guys at work insisting that I go, I finally went.   Foremost, our waitress was really nice. A great waiter/waitress can usually make or break a restaurant experience. She did a great job taking care of us. Although the sun was shinning in my eyes half of the time, the environment was still pleasant. The music was just loud enough to hear but not so loud to have to talk over it and the dining area was roomy. The food wasn't the best food I've ever tasted but it was still worth the experience.   Cornbread - Amazing. You'll find little pieces of corn while you eat. It's literally corn and breading. It's the way cornbread should be. Bottomless basket of chips and three salsas - The chips were pretty good and while the salsas had a lot of flavor to offer my mouth they just weren't as great as I was hoping. Wild mushroom enchiladas - Delicious and different but it could have been served a little hotter. Not spicier, hotter as in heat. Baked seafood enchiladas - My boyfriend's entree. He enjoyed it and was most thrilled about the barbequed shrimp the enchiladas contained. Tropical Guava Mojito - Very sweet but still sooo good. Stoli Blueberi Cosmo - Amazing. I could go back just for the Stoli Blueberi Cosmos and cornbread and leave happy. Best drink of the evening. Prairie Berry Lemonade - Kamikaze in disguise. If you don't like fruit pulp I don't recommend this. There is lemon pulp in this drink. It's served with floating blueberries also. I loved it.   Do I plan to go back? Very likely. If not for the food, definitely for the cornbread and drinks.

iCGhivb6D6uOvwjWT0S5Og.text: Went to Z Tejas in Chandler Arizona last evening for the specific purpose of Taco Tuesday promotion for The Rockin taco festival in downtown Chandler this coming weekend. The promotion was to have tickets for sale 2 for $10, all day long. Once seated and finally wait staff came to our table after a 10-minute wait, we ordered one of the food and drink specials, and I asked about tickets. I was told that they were sold out. This was at 5:30 p.m. . And was told that another location had tickets. Seeing as how there are no other locations in the East Valley I was confused. The taco and drink promotion was for two tacos and a margarita for $12. Which was kind of a joke. The margarita was as small as a cocktail glass, and two small street tacos. The margarita was nasty, but the tacos were good even though there was only two bites to each one. The manager walked by checking on tables and asked if everything was fine. We said the tacos were good and said the reason we came by was for taco Tuesday and to purchase tickets. At that point he told me that they were out of the tickets but the Tatum and Shea location in North Scottsdale had them. The promotion clearly stated Chandler location only. So I don't understand why they would not have them, but Tatum and Shea location does. Z'Tejas completely dropped the ball on this,. I left us with the feeling like this was a "come-on", to get people in to the restaurant. I have no need to ever go there again for taco Tuesday or any other meal.

Asi7zHb0W6JA4mNHmb_ebA.text: 12/17/15 food was fine - today the service not so good! Will I be back yes so far food has been okay. Seems here the service has been a hit or miss. Was some busy but not slammed. Well maybe it was my fault the on tap beer selection is boring. Manager walked by and says hi, not how was everything and would have shared with her, my lunch order had been delivered before I got chips and salsa which I had to ask for. Oh well! Oh she was at the hostess stand when I entered - wasn't the friendliest greet, matter fact I was an interruption, she glanced around to find her hostesses, she didn't even stop what she was doing to help a newly arrived guest.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. The bar

nGn91lxB153OmRg_PA4jBA.text: This location has gone from very good to just OK to terrible in the past months. Tonight was the end of our patronage to this Z'Tejas and probably all the others in the chain. We were 30 minutes into our wait when the manager approached 3 parties in the waiting area and advised that we could not plan to eat there as the 'kitchen was backed up'. There were empty tables when we arrived. Management at this location has hit rock bottom.  Obviously they have staffing issues. And the Sunday Brunch has not been worth the money since last Easter when they modified the menu.  They don't deserve the one star but it is the Yelp minimum.  Do yourself a favor, stay away!  We will for sure.

jWFCd0bEd1BbaePe4iO0Qw.text: Very good atmosphere.  Tried couple of appetizers: shrimp-avocado tostado bites and the triple option (queso, ): both pretty good The warm corn bread they served before our order was just awesome.  However I was disappointed with their chicken fajitas: not sizzling and the chicken wasn't succulent.  My colleagues liked their shrimp pasta.

haexH2mZIhpLg-kQS2xK5w.text: Came to this location on a hungry-stomach-only-had-chips-and-coffee-for-breakfast-whim and tried the chicken enchiladas and bow tie pasta jambalaya special. First, you get warm corn bread with real corn kernels in it on a iron skillet and butter. Yummy! The Santa Fe enchiladas came with rice and black beans for $11. Let's just say that I've had better. The jambalaya farfalle has shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, peas, peppers and onions packed with flavor and spiciness for $16. Note to self: never get the enchiladas.
