Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Santa Fe enchilada
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Corn bread

ogs0qgxyer03ZBPui1Fg6g.text: Decided to bring my mother in law here for a birthday brunch.  It was dreadful! The food was so forgettable it was ridiculous...what a bad choice for such a special occasion.  We sent my mother in laws omlette back and asked for street tacos instead.  They were horrid and of the four we got we left 2.  Never have I been so unwilling to part with $84 as I was at this restaurant.  The one star I have given is for our server Derrick who tried hard to help us have a good experience but it  was  beyond his control.  My family and I  will not be going back to this restaurant.

xCiHPq0kvMbiGrVIYgHs3w.text: I came here once for happy hour, sat at the bar. I ordered the tacos and they were so delicious & packed with flavor. The bartender was very kind & the drinks were so good and pretty strong. I would definitely come back again. I also love the location, I had happy hour & then went and saw a movie.

NMFBoD907XFtcSWjS8Te-g.text: Went to grab a quick lunch today and this place was recommended.  There is ample parking and is located in a shopping plaza.  We got there early and there was plenty of parking, when we left, the place was getting their lunch time rush. The inside was nice and open and decorated nicely which made for a pleasant visit.  We were seated immediately and our waiter started out with the drinks.  We let the waiter know that we were in a rush because we had to catch a plane, this is typically a good test of the urgency the waiter can relay back to the kitchen, which they nailed, great teamwork guys..  They serve some corn bread with butter which was warm and fresh and had a little bit of sweetness.    I ordered the steak burrito which was covered in sauce.  The steak was nice and juicy and they were ample size cuts.  The burrito had a nice little spice to it and came with some rice on the plate.   The only thing I think needs a little change is the salsa and chips.  None of the three salsa's were particularly spicy and didn't really stand out from one another even though they were different styles.

8nY7fCgj_VQkIM5QkDTsSg.text: First, let's get this out of the way. Detracting from giving this place a five star was the fact that on weekend nights it's extremely busy, noisy, and crowded in here!  You can barely hear yourself think, let alone the other person talk.   No, on with the good stuff. Even though we arrived slightly before happy hour but were seated after happy hour the server was nice enough to give us our margaritas at happy hour price!  Good service!  The skillet cornbread that they brought out as an appetizer was simply fantastic. I shared a combination of street tacos and cat fish tacos with the person that I was with. The cat fish tacos were some of the best that I've ever had and the flavor was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Catfish tacos were amazing with my margarita!

XKm4f6oV7KkWywKz1gK_HA.text: I visited Z'Tejas years ago while I was in college.  A friend and I were searching for nachos and decided to try Z'Tejas for happy hour.  I was super disappointed.  The green chili pork nachos were decent with the meat being the best part.  The street tacos and shrimp tostada bites were meh.  The best part was probably the complimentary corn bread.

ryb_TPzxkItH6WoLgKSlWg.text: Ztejas on Ray Road is one of my favorite places to have lunch.  The food is all made from scratch... did you know that?!  Great margaritas yes but no pressure to drink when sitting at the bar.  I could sit there for hours working on my laptop and the bartenders don't mind.  They have free wi fi now did you know that?! so many great things about this place.. It's never a disappointment.

WLZKR1rGsZfY1hOMwxHSfQ.text: Got seated immediately, friendly staff and food is always AMAZING.  Great service! Delicious chicken chili relleno and steak burro. Melts in your mouth with perfect flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

NaMS61y56t8HXsbqpwh8NQ.text: Great atmosphere, food, and margaritas!  Z'Tejas has one of the best happy hours!  The bartending team is awesome, especially Matt, and one of the reasons we keep coming back to this location. Tip: Ask for the 20th Anniversary Margarita.  Although it's no longer on the menu, they can still make it at this location and it's AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. 20th Anniversary Margarita

HVT9bX73W3RcTozJgviYOw.text: Yummmmm! Stopped by here late after a long day.  Service was fast, food was great, prices were excellent. The chili con queso appetizer was good, and the fajitas are amazing. My husband had a simple chicken quesadilla which was also really good. All in all, two appetizers plus drinks and fajitas we spent about $50 including the tip. Will definitely be returning. Highly recommend!

Zx4T-wSeVkHWGFglx6tNOA.text: I've always had great service and hot food here. I really love the guac tostada bites and the diablo chicken pasta.

j1MIcnncUkERgrRHeN5tFQ.text: WIfe finally dragged me kicking and screaming to a Mexican restaurant!  She tried the local Four Peaks Kiltlifter and we both liked it.  WE also wanted try the much lauded Chambord margarita, and since we were there for happy hour they brought us two each!  TOmunch on during the cocktails we had the Texas trio and chips, which was salsa, quest and guacamole.  I chose the catfish for my entree, and my wife went for the Achiote chicken chopped salad, with iceberg lettuce, avocado, black beans, Cotija cheese, bacon, roasted curbs, pepitas, Roma tomatoes, red cabbage and ranch vinagrette.  Great place!

83iv6vUA9ugkb7knv-LQJA.text: This restaurant has recently gotten new owners. A few things have changed but the food is still delicious as ever. For example, they used to give out cornbread as part of the meal. Now it is $3, which is donated to charity. I think the reason they did it this way is because no one is going to throw a fit over money going to a charity. But I'm sure they will eventually just start charging for it without donating. Basically, they are cutting down costs but doing it in a "nice" way. Other than that, I always love the atmosphere, and there isn't an item on the menu that I don't like. The waiters and waitresses are usually very nice and attending. Even when the place is busy, the food comes out pretty quick. The prices are to be as expected for a nicer restaurant. If you're looking for a unique southwestern dining experience, Z-Tejas is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. The chile verde barbacoa enchiladas are delicious!

fME2eXM18CvIsiQUPDhrUQ.text: Went here for dinner last night, on the recommendation of my parents. I have never been to a ztejas with the exception of some catered breakfast meetings.   I really enjoyed their chambord margaritas, which were on happy hour special. The table side guacamole was ok, not the best that I have had. Everyone was happy with their main dishes, which vary from Mexican, or tex-mex inspired.   The service was ok, my parents commented that they have had some pretty awesome servers at this location, however our server seemed a little overwhelmed, she would run to the table, as us one thing, leave and come back and ask again. It took my dad three attempts to order a beer.   I give 3 stars because the service was average and the food was good! I'll give it another try in the future though.

tBzMGD4lYhDznbejHCj7hg.text: We chose this restaurant because it was close to our hotel and only had a twenty-minute wait on a Friday night (which is really short for Friday night.). While we waited outside, the manager offered us drinks and took the time to chat with us and our children to help pass the time.  Inside, the service continued to be exceptional.  Our server was attentive but not overbearing and the manager checked in with us as well.  The food was delicious and well prepared too!

_R_UsX_MYRNIj-h-hcDiOQ.text: It had been a while since I've eaten at Z'Tejas.  Decided to meet up with a friend and have a good Margarita and a bite or two.   Overall it was an excellent experience.  Service -Amazing from being greeted at the door to our amazing server Missy.  She is amazing at what she does.  So amazing that I am writting this review a month later after finding my receipt.  She had amazing recommendations and I ran with them, every item she recommended what amazing.  It obvious she's knowledgeable about the menu and knows how to ask the right questions to provide the perfect recommendation.  One of the best experiences I have had with a server and I eat out tons.  Food -Seasoned well, perfect amount of spice to it. -Looked good and came out hot instead of looking like it had been under a heat lamp and coming out with the "I've been sitting under a heat lamp look"   My Marg was on point!   Atmosphere -Busy, a bit loud but not unbearable.  It was what was to be expected during Happy Hour. -Clean, tables being bused in a timely manner -Clean Restrooms.  Overall I will make sure not to wait so long to come visit again.  I hope to have the pleasure of being served by Missy again as well.

AWmvyAqhZHFBM2V2oLzaKg.text: Eh! Wasn't too impressed with their food and/or Guacamole. I might have to pay them one more visit to truly understand if I just happened to have a bad visit. Reason I was there was because I had heard great things about this place, however, I as not impressed.   Food wasn't too flavorful, and being that it's Mexican food, you'd expect it to be nothing but flavor. I don't know, maybe Im just used to Mexican food being flavorful and juicy. There food was neither.   Service was good, however. Hence the 3 stars.

HTZsMFnrSaGm_ae_fw2XyA.text: Two of my favorite dishes at this place- catfish beignets and the ancho fudge pie! Drinks are tasty as well.

faR_AHZSMN09AXkxNgxAWA.text: Had a great breakfast with my family today :)) food was ya yummy except the hash browns they were hard and dried !!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

tS5-3K3pWfEiUZUsCd7xHg.text: Went to Zetjas yesterday and the dinning room had nats flying every where. We were batting nats left and right. The only thing they could tell us is it's hot out they come in during the hot temps, we are sitting by the bar that draws them to that area. So the manager suggest moving us to another table away from the bar. All our meal plates, our appetizers, our drinks, utensils etc.   We switch tables in the dinning room and encounter the same problem left and right nats. So bad I can feel them hitting my hand every time I bat them away.   All they did was offer their apologies, nice but at that point no one said anything to us about discounting our meal. Or come and try us again when we are not infested with nats!   Funny you can't even go on their website for customer service feed back.  Either way it's sad to think I even finished my meal and paid, full well knowing that there are other restaurants that do not have that problem and it's the same temp for them as it is for Zejtas.  Please know if I could place this feedback on their page I would!!!! Stay clear of Zetjas chandler!

gDPOyFR3uw6j70JhCfIe7g.text: First time here and it was fantastic! I live about an hour away from the chandler area but we needed to waste time to avoid traffic so we stopped in here for dinner. The atmosphere is casual but the restaurant itself is beautiful!   I have been dieting so my mom and I split the chicken fajitas with corn tortillas. It was very good. They have a roasted salsa that's delicious and the guacamole was very good. Great portion to share.   The service was excellent from start to finish! The hostess was very friendly and went over specials and even recommended dishes when we sat down. The server answered all our questions and was very prompt on refills and checking in with us. The manager also ran our food out to us and checked back to make sure everything was great.   Overall great experience with food and service. Will be back when I'm in town. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. MMm chicken fajitas! Delicious!
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beautiful atmosphere!
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken fajitas with extra guacamole. Amazing!

Nu-vSwg3zwuNDmp8-0a5fA.text: Street Tacos - Cilantro Shrimp Presentation 5 out of 5 Flavor 3 out of 5 Value 4 out 5 Salsa 2 out 5  3.5 out of 5 / I wouldn't order them again.  Baja Fish Taco Presentation 5 out of 5 Flavor 1 out of 5 Value 1 out of 5 Salsa 3 out of 5  2.5 out of 5 / I wouldn't order them again.  Final note: Frozen margaritas will get you there, but just overlook their tacos on the menu.   Sincerely, Nacho Average Taco Lover

VPCI2Zozimolnb1DKDM6dg.text: Solid, my wife and I have been coming here for past three years when we are on vacation and the food and service do not disappoint. We've been here during the week and weekend and again service is consistent.  I say order the table side guacamole and the chamboard (adults only) to start.  Then go with the enchiladas (seafood or mushroom) or the steak burrito (red). Street taco are also a great way to go, now we have not had the desserts so I can't give you any help there.

36El3bp_IuMax92kqcKilQ.text: My husband and i were looking forward to a nice lunch, drinks and an air conditioned place to beat the heat.  Went to Z'Tejas and was pretty disappointed with our first 10 minute experience.  Our table was dirty, bread plate was dirty and no one showed up to place a drink order for almost 10 minutes. So, we walked out.   I mentioned what happened to the hostess and the manager, Chris walked out after us.  We told him what happened. He apologized and asked if we would come back in.  We were set at a clean table and offered drinks right away. And, of course their amazing cornbread!  Next came queso and dip that we didn't order. Our food was brought our right away and was delicious. My husband had the smothered burrito which he loved. I had An enchilada that was outstanding.   Chris would not let us pay our bill and was so apologetic. We definitely never expected to be comp'd. Being in a service industry myself, i appreciate that sometimes things happen. It is the manager and staff's job to rectify the situation. Which they did VERY well.  Thank you Chris and the Z'Tejas staff for turning a bad experience into a fabulous one!   We had an amazing lunch!!!!

W87PcKWAr7AJ__XiRckSDQ.text: First impressions are everything! Today was my first visit to this establishment and perhaps my last.  I was disappointed to find that my appetitizer dish in addition to the other plates on the table were dirty.  I proceeded to retrieve three other plates from another table only to find that they too were dirty.   l spoke to the general manager who was very professional about the matter and ensured me that he was working with the staff to correct the issue. The waffles are nothing special but the shrimp tostadas are delicious. So if you can stand possibly finding leftover food on your dishes give this restaurant a try.  By the way I only rated this restaurant a 3 because of the awesome server we had Tammy and the shrimp tostadas.

XGGeScvOOjNZJ0EGWOn35A.text: Been a rough day of trying for a gold mine in my quest to have a good meal I didn't have to cook.  Previously we used to go with colleagues every week.  The chamboard margaritas are amazing!   However.....we ordered: 1) dumplings.  My son loves dumplings but these were dry and chunky.  He took one bite and spit it out.  And he loves dumplings!  Well $10 in the toilet! 2) fajitas.   - beans - too spicy for me and the rest of the crew could not eat either.  But if you like spicy - awesome! - chicken - biggest high and low.  Flavor wise a wonderful chipotle type nacho spice....yum.....except it was so dry we quit after a couple of bites trying to choke down the bites!   - salsa - none so make sure you ask. - rice and mix was nice but no flavor. - came with cheese (I think I asked for extra but don't think I got it). - came with shredded lettuce - loved that they packed it separately so it didn't get warm - cudose! End: May Try again but in house.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

xzWiMmJ1W7bbziwXTFNuxA.text: Good happy hour menu! Chambord margarita is great! Waiting to try the chili pork!! Chili pork was awesome! Good casual place for happy hour

I_Z8dZYE9logdJOTV67luA.text: Great food, excellent service. Visiting from out of town and we loved the restaurant's vibe and delicious food.

_9d6k7VDz8sJ6BZEApEN7g.text: This was better than I expected.  We got there for an early dinner so they still had happy hour going on.  Happy hour is until 7 pm.  We ordered the guacamole made fresh at the table side.  This was very good but no spice even with the diced Jalapenos.  Tammy was our server and she is timely, efficient, polite, attentive, and knowledgeable of the food and drink menu. She is able to make recommendations.  I had the veggies instead of chips for the guacamole.  You can make a meal of that alone.  Fresh, cucumbers, celery and carrots.  The manager came out shortly after the first bowl of veggies and said they didn't peel them and replaced them before we even had a chance to notice.  They even pull the threads off the celery like I do.  (I thought I was the only one) we had the special.  A chicken pot pie with Cajun and green chili cream sauce.  They precooked the chunks of potato before baking them in the pie.  The Zucchini, carrots and other veggies were still crispy like I like.  We ordered a side of cornbread that must have an extra cup of sugar in it with corn kernels.  They do NOT offer a veteran's discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

ZbBm2Fp3qvS9L31pzkBiKg.text: We just had an excellent experience here.  The food and service from our waiter Oscar was exceptional.  I was so happy to see this restaurant is keeping up with the trend of fantastic customer service and exceptional quality and delicious food and atmosphere.  From the moment I arrived I had a good feeling.  My reservation was made conveniently by calling on the phone; they utilize a text service for our convenience (to notify me out table was ready).

sa71wJ_E02gtHxWJGIjL_Q.text: Just came here for lunch & left pretty satisfied. They were having a good rush but our server Chad still did a great job. The corn bread is To.Die.For! I had the pest trout, something like that and it was delicious. My mom had the cilantro chicken with mushroom or something and my little sister had a steak quesadilla. Everything was really yummy. The portions are good for the price. Staff is friendly. Definitely recommend!

BwXq7dCEClDVgXiSKVuzIg.text: Awful experience. Unable to eat the rice because it was undercooked, two of our orders were incorrect, there was next to zero salsa fresca in my burrito so it was mainly just meat and cheese, and the meat was very fatty. Plus our server seemed like he hated being there which meant crappy service for us. Never coming here again.

svM_lVrZDaS_8aBNlcWKvw.text: Server was a nice young man and free cornbread to start was great!  However, after that things went downhill with stale corn tortilla for fish tacos, very small and cold serving of rice on the side and my spouses meal was cold, with leathery chicken. The place has a good atmosphere and potential but we won't be back too soon.

kcWmJQsEy_H0--RBjJwM6A.text: I was exploring random restaurants and found this awesome South Western restaurant.  I ordered 2 Dos XX beers and ordered seasonal Chile Shrimp dish and Mushroom Onion quesadilla appetizers beforehand togo. Both were well cooked and delicious. I hope they keep seasonal shrimp meal as it was spicy but not hot. This place is priced a bit higher but food/beer is high quality. I am impressed and recommend Z'Tejas!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dos XX
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

fRFSIIlHOONK0xAFw8MH5g.text: I ordered off of UberEATS and the food was extremely bland - which was rather surprising. The only flavoring that came through on the steak tacos was the raw onion. The steak itself was gray and sad. Also, the dish said it comes with Southwestern rice and black beans - nope, they lied. Just four tacos, for $16.60. $4.15 a taco. I wish I knew, you can get much better street tacos for $1.50 each right down the street from me. I thought I'd give Z'Tejas a try though, and what a let down. Additionally the corn bread is mediocre - tastes like corn bread you'd get premade from a local grocery store that's been under a heat lamp since the morning.  My boyfriend got the Green Chile Barbacoa enchiladas. In his words, "I feel like I'm eating a TV dinner." All of the food was disappointing, and now I know that I won't be paying a visit in person or order from them again.

BfwJ0nERR3vScE3H_PM07w.text: I'm going to be honest - i thought this place had closed. I'm so happy i was wrong.   We came in for happy hour on Thursday and the place was packed - and happy hour goes until 7pm! Sat in the bar area with Phil and Missy and they took great care of us.   Shared some pork verde and dumplings and they were great. Had the special which was a tequila shrimp (great) and my wife had the chorizo stuffed tenderloin which was out of this world - as with many things in life she wins!   Free cornbread and amazing margaritas- ummm why wouldn't I come back.

wKSkLHsTjDUZrOaoHX6oJg.text: This restaurant was amazing for southwestern comfort food. Free buttery corn bread, then I ordered the guacamole, which they made table side, and then I had a fajita meal. It was delicious. Decently priced and large portions (I had plenty of leftovers)

NqUu3JbQOTGWedHK3ItZhg.text: Happy hour is a must!!! $5 margarita? Can't beat that. The trio (guac, salsa, queso) was really yummy! Fresh cornbread? To die for! I had the veggie/mushroom enchiladas, what sold me was the MOLE SAUCE. So good! I don't typically order all veggie dishes, but with the portos it was hearty enough...too bad I couldn't substitute ALL Porto's, but I understand as they can be pricey (I did ask). They were SOOO BUSY! Way to be on top of things and have a ton of wait staff to help others, I really like seeing that team work.  Hug parties in the back, and I saw a few managers busting their butt too, congrats. Our server was really great, I think her name was Sara

Tb0UHDC_7pSF7wUUDYZOUw.text: I have been to Z Tejas several times and never had a problem. But this time... First off, we go to the hostess, ask for a table for two, and they say it'll be a 20 minute wait and they'll text us when the table is ready. Cool, no problem. We walk around Casa Paloma for a while and then 25 minutes pass without hearing anything. We head back to Z Tejas only to see a large party in front us walking in and immediately being seated. We ask the hostess when we could expect to be seated and lo and behold they find a table for us right away. Once we sit down, I look at the menu and see that the cornbread, which has always been free in the past, now costs $3. Not a big deal but still a bit chintzy in my opinion. We ask the waiter when the change happened and he says "December 1st. Were you guys planning on just snacking on cornbread and hanging out?" The rudeness of this statement and the implication that accompanies it stuns me. Believe it or not, just because I'm younger doesn't mean I don't plan on spending money for a decent dinner. So at this point we walk out and I make sure to tell the hostess why we were leaving and ask her to pass the message along to the manager. I will never come back and I will be sure to tell my friends and family not to either.

L_i41sE_-Bv-ds55TwyzjQ.text: Ok, I actually really like Z Tejas, but last time we visited, the tap water was so disgusting that I have to say something.  To the management team: do whatever you have to do to fix the water situation.  You'll make the cost back on just my visits alone and I am sure others have the same problem.  Lastly, do you really clean the lettuce with that stuff?  To the chef: until this is fixed, use bottled in the kitchen, it's worth it.  One last note, the water taste has been a consistent issue, I've just always ignored it because we like the food so much and can avoid it with tea or coke.  This last time...it was so bad that it crossed the line and required me to adjust my review.

0AIhlE-g165Ah_saRqJ3bw.text: My favorite chicken tortilla soup and corn bread.  Great indoor or outdoor seating.  Many times I have called in for take out food there for dinner parties and have never been disappointed. The food holds great in chaffing dishes and the corn bread is terrific for dinner parties. Cut it into four pieces and place in a linen covered bowl to keep warm and moist. Reheats fabulously.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken tortilla soup.  The corn bread is one of my favorite dinner party helps. Order early in the afternoon for pick up later.

yA8ZsB4mii1Z_xxw4rMwRg.text: Excellent tex mex food and drinks!  My friends and I have gone for dinner but truly their happy hour is THE BEST in town!  The chambord margaritas are to die for!! We also eat the smoked chicken enchiladas and the delicious  catfish beignet appetizers! The beignets are very light battered catfish "fingers" that are served with a southwestern romoulade sauce ( kinda chipotle flavored). The staff are always warm and friendly and take care to serve you promptly.  Definitely a MUST DO dinng experience.

NWX5sBi7l4YtpYMxgTsKiA.text: MY favorite Z's by far! The one on mill is decent but the bloody mary bar here on the weekends is much larger! My service is always amazing and cannot help but ask for the same server every sunday, I cannot believe I have forgotten his name but he is great!  The bloody nary bar is full of different tomato juices and things to put in it, and if they run out of anything they are quick to jump and get you more. The cornbread and peach muffin are my favorite, I dont even like muffins but i always ask for an extra! I also love the jalepeno bacon and always get a side of that also, SOOOO GOOD!! I have yet to come during any hour but breakfast but I must try because it is delic!

YbvKEzdIDffdmZXbX1e6Sw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants especially this location. The service is always friendly and fast, the food is always perfect. The margaritas are amazing especially the chambord!! Chicken Diablo pasta, steak and chicken fajitas, and the Z burger are some of my favorites.

JexySL0FzzjMkMt8xi9VDw.text: Awful.  Just awful.  I've been to Z'Tejas 5-10x in southern California.  This was my 1st experience at this particular one in Arizona.  We came on 12/23 with a decent size party, about 10 with a few kids.  Waiter was not nice or friendly, not in the Xmas spirit let's say, but that didn't really annoy me too much.  We had a male and female waiter, I won't use their names as I don't want anyone to get in trouble/lose a job/or whatever, and they got multiple orders wrong, despite being corrected during the ordering process.  Example, kids meal, chicken strips with sweet potato fries.   Waiter: "ok, cheeseburger with fries?" "No, chicken strips with sweet potato fries" "OK"  15 minutes later, cheeseburger with regular fries show up. This happened with quite a few dishes.  Then he disappeared for the remainder of the meal.  I think he really hated our table because he kept getting stuff wrong and we continually sent stuff back (black stuff floating in milk, wrong orders, etc.).  He served other tables around us, but not ours.  Maybe he was overworked and had a bunch of other tables, but whatever.  Waitress wasn't much better, but still made errors.  Now, the food.  Like I've said before, I've been to Z'Tejas multiple times.  The food here was so bad.  Steak burrito on rice.  Steak was good, rice was horrible, needed to be cooked at least another 10 minutes.  Overall best thing that we ate.  Chicken salad.  Just awful.  horrible presentation, dry chicken, probably the wrong dressing was brought out, etc.  No redeeming qualities here.  Go to mcdonalds and get a better salad or just go to your trashcan and get a better salad.  Chicken Fingers Kids meal.  Worst chicken fingers I've ever had in my life.  How do you screw up chicken fingers?  It was like eating chicken flavored chalk.  Overcooked, under seasoned.  Tostada appetizer or whatever it was, undercooked shrimp aka grey shrimp, had to send it back.  Congratulations Z'Tejas, you found food I wouldn't eat for free.

M9wUvCkVqsXFElP8sfZRww.text: My all time favorite southwestern Mexican place. Their complimentary corn bread is yummy. I can eat that all day. The dish you have to try it out is baked sea food plate. OMG it is made to perfection. Every bite of it is enjoyable . They happy hour menu is also very exciting with $5 margaritas . Love the interiors and the food here !

EKL-U0z-R4hX5qfaTKT-rg.text: After visiting my third or fourth "Mexican" restaurant in Chandler, I have come to the conclusion that I have to drive to an actual neighborhood where people of Mexican descent actually live to get good Mexican.    I think I've had better Mexican in Maine than Arizona so far, it is distressing.  If any of you native Phoenicians (is that how you say it?) out there are reading this review, please drop me a line and PLEASE tell me how to get REAL Mexican food!  Anyhows, this place was very pleasant, I stopped in here late for a drink at the bar, checked their menu and saw the usual American interpretations of Mexican food.  So I can't really rate the food here, but it sure as heck doesn't look like good Mexican to me.  The margarita was their best (shouldn't you get a great one in the Phoenix area?  I think you should) on their drinks menu, made with Cuervo 1800 tequila.  I realized after a few sips that I prefer Sauza Hornitos, but it was passable.  Two inebriated ladies sitting next to us at the bar made the experience more enjoyable!

APB-iZYZZQE_Wzfq1aR9YA.text: Consistently great food. Service has been good too for the most part. Once when we went for lunch they accommodated us as best they could when it came to items we wanted from the dinner menu without us even making a fuss. That's the only thing I dislike about the restaurant. .. the seperate menus. I get why they do it though and just make sure to go after 3 if I want the dinner menu.

VESvTX9QqRh5LIOzoXCgwQ.text: Had a server named Stacy who perhaps was having a bad day. Rolling your eyes at guests is not exactly "great service." Not the best service, not freindly, food ok but not likely to return.

__7-g9YUo3Jvhl8juFWS4w.text: We eat at this location every time we get to the Phoenix area. We have never been disappointed with our food, our server, or our time spent here. My only complaint would be that there is no ZTejas in Fort Worth where I live.

6c1nPsy0qe2vF3oH_OwXrA.text: Crazy good value. Super Happy Hour. Tasty food.  Friendly and fast service. Highly recommended!  Living off the appetizer menu works wonders. Even the cole slaw is awesome!

3ILV-QpOJQma-IXypUBJMA.text: Started great by getting seating right away, in a booth, on a Friday night. Had an attentive and wonderful waiter. Started with yummy tostada bites, good as always. Didn't care for my chicken tortilla soup, but was filled up with the appetizer, corn bread & beer.

1cGyq-dr74DMrhjQx5AZsQ.text: The food had no flavor! Tortilla soup tastes like baby food. Don't waste your money or time.

0GpZbfSwwe5V30hVzanITg.text: You have to get the Red Chile & Mango Steak salad here! It is so delicious and the best part is the salad is huge and I always have leftovers for the next day. It is definitely spicy so only get it if you like a nice kick. Also I recommend coming here for Easter Brunch! My family has been going for years now and they have there bloody mary/mimosa bar and it's a great price or if you really want to get a buzz get the Chambord margarita. It's frozen and you can't have more than 4 because it's that strong haha I highly recommend

nq4Gsj6rCUHNMTE1Ka_rdQ.text: Happy hour gets crazy busy! Must be the fantastic chambord margaritas (limit 3) and appetizers! I'm a huge fan of the Tejas trio dips and the pecan crusted chicken salad.

XIkLpao9Rdir00je4KgjGw.text: My favorite place for brunch in the Chandler/Ahwatukee area! Amazing menu and food! The Mimosa/Bloody Mary bar is so much fun! Cool thing to share, the Brunch menu is available till 3:00pm on the weekend. Sleep in then come here!

PEwJSuaAAcwICLrsogaviQ.text: Now I know where to go for a really good catfish beignets! Warm customer service, nice atmosphere, very tasty street tacos and grilled shrimp guacamole tostada bites. Happy hour is the bomb!

0vS5bQcK2C5Lx3BshTItOg.text: We had a Company Christmas Party here on a Friday night back in December.  Even with the place being packed, the service was awesome and the timing of the food was exactly as we had requested.  Everyone had a great time and loved the food.  I highly recommend booking a party here.

pBo8Zc1B-QnkpuycZhex2A.text: I absolutely adore this restaurant!!! The margaritas are amazing!!! My husband and I go there for happy hour once a week!!! The macaroni is Dee-lish!!!! I highly recommend this establishment with its great food and even better drinks!!!!

GOwwz2E0NH1-kz3Y9lH0cQ.text: The atmosphere here is "fun". Very open dining room with lots of hustle and bustle as well as noise. Therefore very kid friendly because they could make a lot of noise and no one would really notice. The food they have is very much a Southwest fusion with lots of chile used in their dishes. They even have a very good Ancho chile chocolate cake. Every dish here is delish so just find one that sounds good to you.   Visited November 2011

ELbFm7eRamLydPyJ1JuSDw.text: Mass-produced mediocrity. I am not normally so blunt and so negative right at the start of a review, and yet this establishment seems best-described by this three-word opener. Crab cake appetizer was a cold bit of crab blended with a cold mass of filler, heaped on a confused mish-mash of greens, the best parts of which were the pseudo-Remoulade sauce and pumpkin seeds. Navajo taco special consisted of a few shrimp plopped into a mush of rice and cold black beans, all piled atop a cold and greasy slab of Indian fry bread. Hamburger ordered medium-well arrived rare. One good point, our server was very efficient and friendly, which made up in some part for the coldness of the greeter. Will not return.

L-JRPdJQs9zIPX79MsvORg.text: Been there numerous times, but never ordered steak until this last Sunday. I ordered what I thought was steak but received a piece of fat! Thankfully they did not charge it, it was a $29 plate.

ZoURg5yh4WRmuVBp_vBJOQ.text: I had the worst service with management at this establishment. I have come here for years with my family.  It was with much disappointment to find hair baked into our cornbread.  Instead of being embarrassed this manager was actually brash, cruel, and combative. Never visit this location! I will tell everyone about the experience I had here.

-ddOTl6RPE2uYNMh8ea52g.text: Food was yummy, waiter (Kevin) was cute. The chamboro is super super good and not watered down. The hostesses was also super polite and she remembered the friend that I was with. Overall it was a great experience.

BpDocxfGlkKmXeeKosvbLA.text: Terrible food and mediocre service. Tap water is so disgusting it shouldn't be served to customers. My coffee creamer was so dirty it looked like it hadn't been washed. "clean" silverware wasn't even polished so it had water spots all over it. The "chef" here is just an egotistic glorified expediter who tells the line cooks when to fire another quesadilla and sifts through a book of rotating corporate specials and picks one and lacks any really creativity or talent. Definitely way better choices in the area

CalkFEnnBg8xqmWrEb2nDQ.text: We come here often for happy hour and love the margaritas. Last two times the tejas trio has been disappointing. The queso dip has been runny and not the same.

1LY8WnT7iHIn5gv8RVRNZQ.text: Still one of the best happy hours around! Half price (delicious) appetizers. More to choose from than a bunch of fried appetizers!  My favorites are the Shrimp & Guacamole Bites and the Street Tacos.  Margaritas are always good! Bartenders are super busy but still always friendly, smiling and having a great time. Plus, happy hour is in the entire restaurant, not just the bar area, don't see that much anymore.

AnzRxb0iE5OtDj7cMitFeg.text: Met a friend here for lunch.  It was not as packed as I thought it would be.  It was nice, walked in grab a table, and the server immediately stopped by to say hello and ask what I would like to drink.    The corn bread was SO SO good!!!  I ordered from the specialities section of the menu.  Five cheese macaroni & achiote chicken (made with bleu, Jack, cheddar, parmesan and Romano cheeses, finished with toasted bacon gratin).  It was pretty good.

rEXmJiGIYVbS1K4K5u-P5w.text: My boyfriend and I had a long day at work and wanted to get some drinks and split entrees! Z'Tejas more than delivered! Trevor, our waiter, was absolutely amazing! He gave us exemplary customer service with his energy, passion and knowledge of the food and drinks! The atmosphere was lovely for a late romantic dinner with dimmed lights and a low-volume sophisticated demeanor. The food was fantastic! We started with chips and salsa, then a bowl of tortilla soup and then the baked seafood enchilada which Trevor happily recommended! It was so yummy. You have to try the baked seafood enchilada! They even split it on two plates for us and we were very pleasantly surprised!I had the chambord margarita with a sugar rim and it was phenomenal--good amount of alcohol! My boyfriend had the Z Tejas mule, and he's pretty picky about mules--he loved it!  Great service, great food, great drinks and good prices! We'll be back soon!!!

FVFJAcfjz3BRiVCIc6q5tw.text: Good after work happy hour! Great lite lunch selections and always seating at the hi-tops at the bar. Z' Tejas is a solid standby.

ayoP80N4sithJH0hCG_zcA.text: With the woman in my life enjoying an awesome dinner ! Great Margaritas! You must try the frozen one.

csEUWLLxP9X8K-JATwuKIw.text: Love this place. Got seated quickly by very friendly staff. The food was amazing. Had the wild mushroom enchiladas. Would definitely go back.

bgzF9tdKVCe7_8i42SJinQ.text: As PF Chang's is to oriental cuisine, Z'Tejas is to Southwestern.  Same idea.  I didn't say it was a good idea.  It's ok, not great.  PF Chang's pulls this trick off wonderfully.  Z'Tejas, not so much.  We went for lunch and were seated immediately.  The place we had originally planned on going had a line out the door.    This is a huge restaurant and beautifully appointed.  Servers were all nice and did a good job.  It's a little dark in here.  It was lunch and had numerous windows but unfortunately we were not seated near them. I had trouble reading the menu.  The corn bread and butter starter is a nice touch.  Everyone likes a freebie.  It just wasn't that tasty.  Nothing special.  I went with a dish off their "seasonal" menu and it did not disappoint.  That being said, it wasn't overly special either.  The beans and rice were okay also but again, nothing special.  The bill came quickly and we were out the door in less than 45 minutes.  Very efficient.  Not the best southwestern food I've had but it's decent.  Don't expect much.

HlkhFMoix4SaINYUKnKM0g.text: The Diablo chicken was amazing. I got mine without the jalapenos and it still had a bit of a zesty kick.

9Cd48tFD6hSxrKBwF_Xs2Q.text: This restaurant is amazing!  Delicious food and drinks at reasonably low prices.  They also have great servers that provide excellent customer service.  I was glad we dropped in to visit family and they suggested this place.  I wish there were Z Tejas Grills in San Diego!

qWMyjkZm1D4a-PrCm28Z-Q.text: Ordered nachos to share with a friend. Disappointed that it literally came with about 6 chips topped with meat, cheese, beans, & a jalapeno strip. 6 chips...6!

bIqGGn4Ok2tGpT-5ndreXg.text: I don't know why the food was not on par yesterday. Normally their Z burger is the best in the valley.   My daughter and I both ordered the same thing: z burger cooked medium rare with fries. My fries were to be extra crispy.   The burgers were both served well done, no pink at all, and the fries were not crispy at all. Quite soggy in fact.   Waitress never came by until we were almost done eating. I didn't bother telling her, as I didn't want a whole different meal by then.   Restaurant was not very busy. This is sad, as they have closed all but two z burgers in the valley and this one is going down hill in service and food.

t-jjwHjz6YjeNfjxzxhP-Q.text: Its been a loooong time since we've visited this great restaurant!!  Bummer to have seen the Scottsdale Fashion Square located shutter however, the Tatum and Shea location is still killing it with all the fantastic food that has made Z a one of kind restaurant along with their famous 6th st. Frozen Margs!!   In addition, our server Megan, was so top notch!  Her smile, friendliness and attention to her customer made the experience unlike any other.  Thank you Megan. Your the best!!

HKtdsV-uf7sMZQ2j-kRNig.text: I love love love this cute place!  I go for the happy hour menu and $4 chambord margaritas on Tuesday...all day!  They are divine and Phil the Bartender is so personable and remembers people's names!   That's huge in my book and that alone will keep me coming back because in customer service being able to remember names is an art form.  Thank you for a great place! Love that it's on my way home our whole family loves it here!  Will always come back!  Highly recommend!

4w2ionKz3dDMe6EXXM_RcQ.text: I have not been here since 2011. Hard to believe yes. However, we came here the other night for a friends Birthday. We came for Happy Hour. I will start by saying we had the nicest server. This guy was great. He was very attentive and new the menu well. He even brought out a dessert for my Friends Birthday. She was very happy as they even lit candles in it. All the drinks we got were on special for HH.We ordered Cat fish Tacos, which are in a soft shell, a little different but, we all liked them. We also got chips and Salsa with Queso.,very good indeed. As well as fried Catfish strips, they were really great. We had a nice evening and excellent service. Lots of Parking and restrooms were clean and well maintained.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. The dessert they brought out for Kim&#39;s Birthday.Very nice.
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Happy Hour drinks

5-b7Rzl4Dnl6bGsZNiRAHg.text: It' so nice to see seafood on a Mexican restaurant menu. And l'm not talking ceviche but actually main entrees. Z'tejas has several seafood choices, l picked the catfish tacos and loved it! Service was excellent and margaritas were tasty, l'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

DvALk0w0P_EwNuEGSquozQ.text: Had brunch here yesterday they have an excellent happy hour. It's Monday through Sunday from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. can't beat that. They give you a couple of dollars off of their Margaritas drinks and everything including $3 off of her famous appetizers the table guac is excellent make sure you add your extra salt cuz they don't do it for you the shrimp empanadas with the guacamole and are good and we had two chicken quesadillas which are awesome you have to come and check them out of course we love happy hour Z'Tejas is great for happy hour Monday through Sunday

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cornbread
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Happy Hour

VntK3grnsHpTLJidNhTTTw.text: Ives been coming to Z'Tejas for a long time and the food is consistently good, not great, but good. I like their seasonal Green Chile burger and their salmon is not bad. Good food for the price.

YU3J27sq-WrvP0---qMitQ.text: Not sure if I just visited at a bad time but the service we received was nothing like I'd expect from Z'Tejas and the food wasn't as good as it used to be. Visited on a Friday afternoon, they weren't busy AND we had a reservation. Somehow we still waited over 30 minutes for our table to ready. Not sure what would have happened if we hadn't said anything but they eventually sat use once we pointed out how long we'd been waiting, the fact that we had a reservation, and that there were plenty of open tables... Our waiter had a bit of a smart mouth but at least our food came pretty quickly. Just wish it was as good as it was when I used to visit this location.   Just updating this because I reached out to the Director of Operations as I was advised to do below. It has been over a week and I still have not received a response. Disappointing. I truly used to enjoy going to Z'Tejas.

wam_WRrZF4a6uGB0fHkYWA.text: My wife, cousin and I stopped by for happy hour and a bite. My cousin had a burger with sweet potato fries. She liked the fries and said the burger was cooked just right. My wife had the catfish tacos and I had chicken quesadillas. Both tasted great. We each had a margarita that was made just right. Their margarita mix is excellent. Great wait service added to a fun evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

JboyH1bWaR5E3t64YHhp0g.text: Food was amazing and had the best service. We plan on making this our go to spot on our way back to Tucson . All the staff was very nice and it was a breath of fresh air being is such a beautiful restaurant.

16T6_yR0z8DllV25L1SByw.text: I placed an order via Uber Eats tonight because this restaurant wasn't listed as a delivery option in Yelp. This was my first to-go order and one that I can foresee the restaurant and Uber blaming each other for the mishap. I ordered the Z burger, chicken tacos, a smothered burrito,  and a shrimp appetizer. The order was delivered quickly especially on a Friday night. Yet, I didn't receive the smothered burrito leaving one of my family members without dinner. Then I bit into the chicken tacos and chomped on a bone. Major disappointment for my first time as a customer. I did like the shrimp app that was flavorful. I was not impressed with the chicken tacos despite the "bone happenstance."  It was dry and lacked seasoning. My biggest let down was their prices. Items are over priced for the quality. Not impressed. Not authentic. Not detail oriented.  Certainly not recommended to my fellow Yelpers, and overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos with rice and beans
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Shrimp app- really good with a kick!
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Smothered burrito

8efsQAPzJS_PuVjGTrJW2A.text: I love love this place!  Me and friends go often. Mainly on Friday's after work and they never disappoint. Great vibes. Everyone is friendly and attentive and the Chambord Margaritas are soooo good! Always flowing! I personally like the grilled shrimp tostada bites with cucumber. I also love the shrimp tacos! I definitely recommend the chandler location. 2 thumbs up!

oATtSeWWc2cCHbdJA9pHOA.text: Good atmosphere, great service, but unfortunately the food was not good. The smothered burrito and z'burger did not taste fresh, and both were room temperature; hardly even warm. Derrick, our server, was awesome though.

H_mULmD1_yWIvMexGGTNfQ.text: Nice location and friendly service. Ally was our waitress and we could have not asked for anyone better. She really made the experience that much better. Ally came to check on us often not too much and not too little. She was quick at taking our orders and getting them right the first time(i know it also involves the cook). We started with a trio appetizer, and the guacamole was lacking seasonings, the red salsa was good with a perfect spice to it, and the Chile con queso was not impressive. My mom and I had tacos she had carne asada and I had shrimp. The proteins were really tasty and seasoned just right, but the tortillas were hard on the edges and cold. That part was unappetizing so I ended up eating two of my tacos with no tortilla which is crummy because I ordered tacos. They also brought out cornbread and that cornbread was delicious I could have ate 10 of those, but of course didn't. For sides my mom had rice and it was okay not the best a little dry. I had black beans and the Z salad. Beans were good again a little something was missing. Now the salad was delicious! It was fresh, colorful and it was refreshing eating it. For drinks we had a tea and a lemonade the lemonade did not taste homemade, but I really enjoyed I had about 2 cups of it and that's unlike me. I tend to just drink water with my meals.  The restaurant was clean, staff was amazing, but the food was not so great considering there pricing I expected more. I think I would be willing to go back just because of the staff, but we will see.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lemonade and iced tea
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Corn bread
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Z salad with ranch

762LWLUIE7wRVpju1RzAFA.text: Excellent Mother's Day celebration at Z Tejas... Service was great... management stepping in and helping out because so busy... food came out wrong(one item) and was immediately fixed and brought out quickly ... must say, awesome job

3PMcs6D1sxQV0JwrBmLmMw.text: Always shocking to me that now Mexican food places have started charging for chips and salsa.  The food is not bad but if the choice is to go to another place with better food and free chips and salsa I would do that. Service was OK nothing great but nothing too bad

Zbqb6BNhqCGKw1BSPUaSTg.text: Glad this SouthWest chain didn't completely go away (they shut a few locations), still a great place to go for great SW food. This place had nice ambiance, great bartender, manager, and of course lunch was fantastic and delivered to the table very fast. Can't but help give it 5 stars because I have nothing to complain about. I hope they ADD more locations!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

eT6erLMErn-dsMT7g4vtAA.text: Came here on a Monday for a business lunch. We made a reservation but they didn't have our seats arranged. Waited an extra 10-15 minutes - fortunately our clients came in a bit later so they didn't wait as long.   The service was on the slow side. Looking around there weren't that many tables, but still took about an hour to get our main entrees. The table side guac was good but everything else seemed mediocre if not worse. The server got 2/8 orders wrong (I.e forgetting to substitute beans for rice or removing bell peppers). For me, I ordered the crispy salmon and noticed it was raw quarter through the food. Definitely felt the salmon swim upstream afterward. Bleh.   First time at ztejas, probably last time.

9PTHAquw_UsuSHjq6d7PDg.text: Dissappointing..  Not worth the wait. It was my first visit and the order took a while. I had the smoked chicken enchiladas, it was blah, not flavorful or authentic. Pollo Loco would have been better.

ZtYdKDV9zd4XIjMCsDGgrw.text: Came here for happy hour which is M-F 3-7 and weekend 2-6pm. Keagan the bartender is wonderful and attentive. Street tacos are great meat and the green Chile is tasty. Hooray for margaritas!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

y1qReB39GGwrZP4kl5XyPg.text: Appetizers aren't good!! And waaaay to pricey! The drinks are wonderful though. A good overall happy hour spot.

P1tTiOF9b2zAnhhzApRPwA.text: Have been going here for years, and getting...and loving the cornbread.  However, as of the 1st of the month, they started charging $3.00 for the cornbread...but neglect to mention that.  I would think if they changed the policy just a couple of weeks ago that they would now inform customers that they are charging for cornbread...which was free.

N5JZilG_jp-qW1fg2Juh-w.text: I had never been to this place before. My boyfriend recommended the margaritas as some of the best in town. So I said let's give it a go. When we walked in, there was no wait and were seated right away. The service was a bit slow at times but our waitress was very pleasant. We tried two different margaritas each and they were all pretty tasty.  As for the food, the chips and salsa were unimpressive for being house made salsas and I wish that they only carried the blue corn tortilla chips (unfortunately there were only 3 in the entire bowl...). The cornbread that they serve was surprisingly delicious. I'm very familiar and very particular with my southern styled food. And this cornbread did not even need the butter that they brought out.  As for the main dishes, he ordered the mushroom enchiladas and I the santa fe chicken enchiladas. He said his was good being paired with sauteed vegetables and black beans. I believed him due to the fact that he did not leave much on his plate! :) As for mine, it was okay. The green chile rice they served alongside the enchiladas was not good at all but the vegetables were okay. The chicken itself was flavorful and had an okay spice level. But the 'bbq' they place ontop in the form of a "Z" kind of threw it off.  Overall, it was decent for the price point and the margaritas were pretty tasty. So I cannot think why I would not be back. However, I cannot think this would be my first choice for anything besides good margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sangria rita
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. 20th anniversary rita
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

p3PCkCROVrcl2EOg42vtdw.text: Chambords margaritas, mushroom enchilada, and cornbread are absolutely amazing. Total recommendation if this is your first time here!

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

7n9o7DJgMPfKs1pFByYE3g.text: Ok we have to pay for cornbread, no biggie for a cause. We said ok stop explaining like we are cheap. I mean we both ordered steaks, not apps. But then don't check on us, ask for a second drink. Felt rushed all night and wasn't busy and not closed. Bummed used to be a good experience

V8JdGmizn2LpClPAloI9yw.text: We haven't been here for awhile but were SO happy to revisit. Our meal from start to finish was top-notch and our server couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Darn, I wish I could remember his name - a clever nickname that I swore I'd remember. Oh, well - he was amazing. Our fresh guacamole was terrific and that cornbread is always cooked to perfection. Can't get enough! Our margaritas were dynamite too. I ordered the ruby trout and it was spectacular. Loved the sides as well. My friend ordered the stacked enchilada and that was flavorful too. I don't think you could go wrong with just about anything on this menu. Oh, and Happy Hour prices are very affordable. Thanks!!

Ulf1UE6PrCMB0xUNp0mbwA.text: Food excellent.  Service exceptional .  Drinks on Happy Hour great.   Down side the place is generally noisy but the obnoxiously  noisy women behind us made it impossible to have a conversation.

59DFkReefM9gtwarWI8e3w.text: I only want to write a review to give Phil, the bartender a shout out. He is awesome and always on top of his game! Other than that, Ztejas is amazing. I have loved everything on the menu! Great chicken, burgers, pasta, tacos, salad, and burritos!

TKe05iDhMWMz9k5H6yHCdw.text: So with all the reviews that I read I didn't know if I should try it or not and opted to give it a shot since I had never been. We got cornbread, chips and salsa, Diablo pasta with shrimp and the New York strip.  My husband seemed to enjoy the cornbread, I think he was hungry.  The chips and salsa were chips and salsa. The steak was cooked perfectly at medium rare but needed a lot of salt. My first bite of my Diablo pasta I made a face because it was something about the flavor. It was Rosemary. I don't like Rosemary. The pasta was not overcooked it would've been more enjoyable if I like the flavor.   So we discussed if we would ever come back and probably not. But if we did we would probably order something else.   Our waiter was friendly!  It was noisy but not too bad. I could still hear my husband talking across  table.  So we gave it a shot and onto the next.

UmqYfQavg3rjWA7G6UwL4g.text: I can't say nothing but great things about Z'Tejas. My husband and I eat here at least once-twice a week. I usually get the avocado chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries (YUM!!!!) and my husband gets the chopped chicken salad or the steak burrito. The restaurant is always packed, but the servers do a great job and are always attentive.   If you're looking for a great happy hour, they have the best around, hands down. Nothing beats their chambord margarita and tejas trio. The best part is that they have happy hour on the weekends all afternoon!  If you've never been, you have to try it!

6203fxp4Yo5L_x4usxapyA.text: Went here for some happy hour margaritas and chips + guac. The margarita was okay, but I didn't taste much tequila in it. And it was pretty small...maybe I just like to drink...  The tableside guacamole is cute idea, albeit a little awkward. The texture was nice and chunky but there was something missing in the spices...cumin, perhaps?  I really liked that they had a vegetarian menu with decent-looking options on it. Not many chain restaurants in Arizona go out of their way to do that!  Overall, it was alright...nothing too special and still a chain restaurant.

5tMG5wsUl6R4DTAIzokjUw.text: I was NOT impressed at all. I was really excited about trying this place because a friend was raving about it.   My friends ordered two micheladas, the guy asked "do you want the beer mixed with the clamato juice? with lime? with a seasoning on the rim?" we answered "Yes!" When the drinks came, it was just a glass of beer and a side of clamato juice for two beers. We were not aware that they had to share the juice. I asked for a cheeseburger well done, no bacon and it was medium well with bacon. I know I probably won't get sick if I eat pink meat, but that was not what I ordered. One thing my friend did like was the jalapeno mayonnaise.   I have to say this place is over priced and not worth my drive. I can get better food and service in Tucson at Sir Vesas.

wt5gUAihniWB9fcmVSjUvA.text: Good place to come after work.  The appetizers on the happy hour menu are the way to go.  I was very disappointed in my seafood burrito - hardly any toppings at all!

KPL8zgyhBd54dLth4ScESg.text: Bloody Mary and mimosa bar are awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Grown up grilled cheese!

xOk5VYfI5WH5rmXRo3SNKA.text: Stopped here for lunch with some co-workers on our way back to the office after an interview.  Was seated quickly and our server arrived shortly there after to take our drink order . . . drinks arrived and our order was immediately taken.  Quick service.  While waiting for our food we received a telephone call letting us know that we had gotten the project . . . whoo hoo a $13,000,000.00 school . . . just wat the doctor ordered.  Back to the food . . . it arrived quickly and hot . . . ordered the Chili Relleno . . . which tasted great, along with the corn bread.  So why only four stars you ask . . . I have to go back once the high from getting the new project wears off . . . just to verify that they do deserve five stars . . . didn't what my judgement clouded.  With that said . . . see you here again soon . . .

OTHnjvGKMx3EEzyBzV2ORg.text: Cornbread!!! Complimentary cornbread after your order. I love their margarita flight, the best is the 6th Street. It's a good place for lunch and one of the best places for happy hour

pRtIL2Cd5RjBsQesLbilug.text: I was in the mood for something I don't always get for my lunch break last week so I decided to go to Z'Tejas.  I'd been to their other locations but never this one surprisingly.  The hosts at the front were very friendly, the one who walked me to my table actually stayed and made conversation for a couple minutes which hardly ever happens anymore.  My actual server was very friendly too.  I was very happy to see that they had a Build Your Own bar where you could pick from a Bloody Mary, Mimosa, Screwdriver and one other drink I can't remember and it was incredibly cheap!  Only $4 for my Bloody Mary!  They had a wide variety of choices too as far as juices, fruits, vegetables, seasonings, sauces, it was hard to decide!  For my actual entree I ordered the Hickory Burger which has barbecue sauce, chopped onions, bacon, jalapeno mayonnaise and a couple different cheeses.  It was delicious!  Kind of a mess to eat but worth every splatter you get on your face and shirt.  I just wouldn't recommend ordering it if you're with someone you're trying to look dignified in front of... The fries were great too.  Nice and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.  I was definitely happy with my decision to switch up my lunchtime location and I will for sure be coming back in the future.

BXGT2DEUoYsbG6xH83MJRg.text: My wife an I stopped February 4th for an early dinner. The service was pretty good although it took awhile to be waited on. My wife said her food was OK but not good. I had a Mexican fish dish and I had to choke it down. I really thought I might be eating tainted fish. Fortunately I did not get ill. We will not stop again.

7ly52_3TdJGB7vkpRMOUjA.text: Don't eat or drink anything at this place! Came here after golf today with friends and ordered a happy hour margarita, it was mostly ice. Will never come here again and will tell all my friends to avoid this restaurant.

IFZkh93loZ-yxEf5ssxz8Q.text: I'm pretty sure I'm biased based on the almost 15 years I've been enjoying myself at Z'Tejas. Over the years I've enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and most notably the customer service. Honestly, it's been years since I've felt like a customer as at this point in my living I'm a part of the Z'Tejas family. Every time I'm in I'm reminded from the time I walk in the door that I'm family based on seeing my ChamFruzion being prepared. The staff here over the years has been phenomenal. To this day even former Z'Tejas members that have transitioned away from the restaurant keep in contact and still refer to me as the One and Only ChamFruzion Nick. A True testament to leadership on creating a culture that's appreciated by just the customers, but employees as well! I appreciate you Z!  Nicholas SupperClub of Phoenix President

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

5QbLnA8J3eC_aDLxJZw56w.text: Do not listen to anyone who doesn't rate Z Tejas 5 stars, I've never been more impressed with a chain restaurant.   The food was phenomenal. Free cornbread and sweet butter!? What's not to love. Can't eat Mexican without free chips and salsa? Don't worry they have that too! My girl had a skinny marg x2 and I stuck with a Diet Pepsi because I was crushing cornbread. My fish tacos were cooked to perfection, her smothered burrito had incredible flavor and I must say the portions were right on as well. Not too much but left feeling full.   The service is what really puts them over the top, our server was Derek, and he was spectacular. Very attentive and was genuinely happy to help and focused on us. The manager even came by and didn't just check on us but offered suggestions, and was happy to refill our drinks as well. Every one there was happy you came in and it came through in every aspect. If you're looking for cheap Mexican and cheap service don't go to Z'Tejas, but if you want an authentic tex mex where the passions comes through in you're whole experience, GO, NOW!

hRh2K6ND7i_d3FIwc18tNQ.text: What a disappointment. This place was so good back in the day.  We came last night and the food was average. The frozen margaritas tasted watered down. My friend ordered a medium cooked center cut filet that came out rare. She asked them to cook it more and instead of putting it back on the grill or giving her a new one, they microwaved it! The server told us they did!!! They said they couldn't put it back on the grill for health reasons.  But y'all... we knew... that steak came back grey!! It was so nasty. Luckily they removed it from the bill.... but it doesn't matter, we won't be back.  And in response to the manager - we were in late night, May 11th. It was our Mother's Day dinner. I'm sorry you don't remember something so awful.  What restaurant does that?!?

669qmASJA7j4C4auadVXNw.text: Best thang about this place was the cornbread. I was disappointed in everything else. Ordered the nachos. Dry and flavorless. Shrimp rounds with guacamole  Spicy shrimp was soft and squishy. I've gone here before a few years ago and it was good. Taco Bell was better than this. Happy hour was not happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

G-55W0A-8XqYzMTkm1ahvA.text: Really sad I chose this for "happy hour!" I loved the Scottsdale Fashion Square location and this was not even close! Sat in bar area and wasn't given chips or cornbread??!! Ummm, that's always been a standard of yours and wonder why I was ONLY table without?  Ordered street tacos, margarita, and shrimp tostada appetizer. The margarita was 1/3 of the size of the former Scottsdale location and there was no hint of tequila in it (also $8 on Happy Hour??) The street tacos were fantastic and better than I remembered!! The shrimp tostada appetizer was just okay- too much guac/hot sauce ration- out of balance.  I really wanted your yummy cornbread or even chips and salsa and wondered why it was never offered even though EVERY table had it except mine.  Very disappointing- there's a reason Scottsdale and Arcadia locations closed! Won't be back:(

3VqbSu2iSpQJq1ZU47Z_Pg.text: I decided to come through after Christmas during happy hour when I expected the place to not be as crowded and I was looking for an opportunity to sit in the bar area to enjoy some sports.  This has been one of Chandlers reliable happy hour spots with a great crowd over the years. My crowd type may differ from your crowd type, but the mix of professionals lends itself to a good laid back vibe and ideal location to meet up or socialized. Plenty of other spots in Chandler are available, but the food items and frozen margaritas are what really stands out. Yeah, if you like a sweet fruity taste to your drinks, then definitely go for the special frozen Chambord Margarita (on happy hour special of course) and it's strong & good!!  Happy Hour runs M-F 3-7pm & on the weekends from 3-5pm. Apps I believe are $3.00off so worth it. The food items are really good and I think that is what separates it from the other happy hours in the area. As usual, I went with the Catfish Beignets, Grilled Shrimp and Guacamole Tostada Bites & the Cast Iron Skillet Dumplings...   My only complaint the last go-round was the service I and a few other at the bar received. It wasn't crowded, but we felt rushed and not really appreciated. From requesting more water, getting another drink, or placing a food order, it was just way to difficult.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chambord margarita
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Catfish Beignets

6ozUeex9Cj8KUPJNRp0pRA.text: Here for happy hour and it's always standing room only unless you can luck into a seat. Get here early if you don't want to stand. They're known for the frozen margaritas and boy are they good! Hubs and I stalked a couple and snagged their seats right as another couple was moving in! We ordered the frozen margs and the shrimp tostada bites. Yummy!

TpPELsq5V_rHbD0xbJo27A.text: We had a large work group and our server handled it with ease. He brought out 3 cornbreads for the table and everyone loved them. We ordered a few appetizers: quesadillas and table side guac. It was awesome that they had the option to add fresh veggies instead of chips for those trying to eat healthy!   For my entree, I ordered the crispy salmon with double veggies instead of rice. It comes with a crab and avocado salad piled on top. The salmon crust was crispy, and thankfully not dry. I loved the vinaigrette that all over the plate. The veggies were string zucchini, squash, carrots and green beans. They were a perfect pairing.   Everyone else in our large group also loved their meals. One got the Voodoo pasta and a few ordered the street tacos. We were all super pleased with the food, the service and the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

FsydOjXTEPbVk2cjbucHyw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. I love the food there but the waiters/waitresses aren't the best. The menu always has really great specials and a wide variety of food. So if your looking for a kinda of expensive place to eat go here.

tuN-6PiA8Kw8XaONI93ezA.text: It was my first time visiting Phoenix and I knew that before I left that I needed to see what the hype was about AZ Mexican food! I came here for lunch with a group of coworkers and it was the perfect place to come for a big group. They have a large menu, which includes a section with healthier items. We started with the corn bread, which was some of the best I've ever had. Great starter and would highly recommend. I had the hardest time picking my main meal, but I heard great reviews about the enchiladas. They were the perfect lunch size, but they were just alright. It's a fun place to come to so I would still probably come back but just for drinks and apps.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States. Green Chile Carnitas Enchiladas

zMGPwNXKu47CZmc1DdQTXA.text: Start to finish was mehhhh. Totally bummed because many years ago when I lived in the valley, I was a regular at the Scottsdale location.  So when a friend suggested this (because I've been working in Tempe), I was stoked.  We came for lunch and from the start things were bad. The waiter was MIA the whole time. I sat with empty water and tea. He delivered our food and never asked about it. I literally had to flag down another waiter to get drinks.  The food was very underwhelming. It tasted old and processed.  By the time we flagged the waiter down for the second time, we asked for the check. He quickly dropped it off and then never came back. The place was less than half full.  I guess the good old days of going to ZTejas will stay in the past. I wish I could have at least gotten a marg, but can't during work. That's one thing I'm sure is still the same.

u4CMShWOvRJoLLl5yFzlLg.text: Exactly what you would expect from the chain. Good not great but predictable which is a good thing.

C63u60LA_g71FecY_7ykEQ.text: My girlfriend and I always come here at least once a month to have margaritas and they are some of the best ones we get muddled jalapenos in them really tasty and quest dip as well . Usually sit at the bar for best service !

f8amu6JoT1aOgiaOP7T-wg.text: I am a huge fan of their Mac and cheese dish! It really has a lot of flavor though I wish you t had more seasonings and herbs! Tried the prickly pear margarita while I was here and and it was delicious  comparable to my favorite frozen margarita with blackberry chambord liquor. Haven't been to this particular location before but I would definitely enjoy going here a second time.

yb_KZvknnxps74AZrXbA0w.text: Went here the other night for happy hour.  Their margarita specials are very reasonable and they also have a good selection of drafts.  Our group ended up ordering a few quesadillas, the chicken and beef were particularly good.   Also, the complimentary cornbread was a nice touch.  The patio out front was pretty full but we found a table.  It wasn't too distracting even though it was in front of the parking spot.  They seem to have a problem with bugs though, maybe some citronella candles would sort that out.

8w0_Ab9IaIR6B5imgQA0Bw.text: We were regular patrons of this restaurant chain when we lived in Utah.  We have adult children living in the Phoenix area and this is one of their favorite hangouts. We tend to come here each time we come to visit. We've always been pleased with the service, the food quality, and pleasing decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Z'Tejas - Chandler, AZ, United States

E1le38jVYgZGog9agw_6CQ.text: Z'Tejas is one of my favorite places in Arizona for happy hour.  I believe they have some of the best frozen margaritas in town.  The food .. skip it.  They miss the bar every time on the food.  Nothing significant there at all!  This location is super family friendly.  The bar area is boring so don't expect a good time ... the cocktails people ... this is all about the cocktails.  This location (maybe others, I'm not sure), but this location has a sign on the outside of the door that say Happy Hour Monday - Friday 3 pm - 7pm.  Saturdays all day.  We said SCORE, perfect!  When we sat down to order, I immediately asked the server "Happy Hour all day".  He said, Ummm I don't think so.  I told him there's a sign on the outside that said Happy Hour all day.  He walked outside, looked at the sign, came in and spoke with the manager.  Once he came back to our table he told us I saw the sign, it definitely says Happy Hour All Day Saturday but our manager said it's wrong. -_-  Cool!  2 Chambord Margaritas please!   We were pretty hungry so we shared the shrimp fajitas.  Nothing significant here .. honestly, Chilli's has better fajitas but hey ... again .. we're here for the cocktails

Th8Qm8sbf5kSbKFDvGe8Iw.text: The food was OK, nothing to write home about. I had the smallest margarita and enchiladas I have ever been served. I won't return. Poor value for the money. I am reminded of the old Wendy's advert..."Where's the Beef!?".

8-DUNXv_EvnNCjCnkj831g.text: Horrible, horrible, horrible! Do NOT waste your time or hard earned money here. This restaurant has been having issues for at least the last year.  It's been about a year since my last visit and I decided to give it another try. Wow, big mistake. We got to the restaurant about 1:00 pm, well after the lunch rush. Although something tells me they don't get big crowds. The restaurant was pretty quiet, not many patrons. We got seated at a booth by a window which was nice. After that the whole experience sucked.  The waiter finally came to take our order. About 20 minutes later he came by the table and I asked about our food. Did they need to go to the store and buy it? And then prep it all? The restaurant was uncrowded. Why was it taking so long?  Surprise! He immediately comes out with the food. And guess what? It was COLD! I was not happy, but since I hadn't eaten anything all day and was starving, I ate it.   It was really gross to eat something cold that would've been so delicious if served hot.  At least the food temp went up to 98.6 once it got inside my tummy. Oh, and the waiter, Ryan, never apologized or gave us a reason for the delay.  Clearly it had been ready for a while and he neglected to get it.  Terrible service.  He never once came by to ask us how it was, as is customary in most restaurants.  Probably because he knew he messed up big time.   I did not see any manager on duty, which may be part of the problem. This restaurant has been in decline for quite some time now. It's sad because it used to be a great place and now it just SUCKS!  And I have to mention that my husband's burger looked quite red inside.  Definitely NOT medium well as ordered.  Please do yourself a favor and go anywhere else but here. Not worth the frustration and the food's not cheap either.  If I could give it zero stars I would.
